article:
**2 Good 2 Be True**

2 Good 2 Be True is a Philippine romantic comedy-drama television series that premiered on May 13, 2022, on Kapamilya Channel. The series is based on the 2003 South Korean television series "Lovers in Paris," which was also adapted into a Philippine television series in 2004. The show follows the story of two people who meet and fall in love in Paris, but their relationship is put to the test when they return to their respective lives in the Philippines.

# Premise
## Plot

The series revolves around the story of Erika, a beautiful and kind-hearted woman who works as a tourist guide in Paris. One day, she meets a wealthy and charming man named Jethro, who is on a business trip in the city. Despite their different backgrounds and personalities, they fall deeply in love, and their relationship becomes the stuff of fairy tales.

However, their happiness is short-lived, as Jethro is forced to return to the Philippines to take care of his family's business. Erika, who is determined to be with the man she loves, decides to follow him to the Philippines, where she faces a new set of challenges and difficulties.

## Themes

The series explores several themes, including love, family, and identity. Erika and Jethro's relationship is put to the test as they navigate their differences and confront their own personal demons. The show also explores the complexities of family relationships, particularly in the context of Filipino culture.

# Cast and Characters

## Main Cast

* Kathryn Bernardo as Erika Santos, a beautiful and kind-hearted woman who works as a tourist guide in Paris.
* Daniel Padilla as Jethro Castillo, a wealthy and charming man who falls in love with Erika in Paris.
* Ronaldo Valdez as Augusto Castillo, Jethro's father and the patriarch of the Castillo family.
* Gloria Diaz as Margaret Castillo, Jethro's mother and a wealthy socialite.
* Gardo Versoza as Rick Santos, Erika's father and a hardworking man who wants the best for his daughter.

## Supporting Cast

* Pamu Pamorada as Bernadette "Bernie" Santos, Erika's best friend and confidant.
* Andrea Brillantes as Lala, Erika's cousin and a precocious teenager.
* Bodjie Pascua as Mang Peps, the Castillo family's loyal and trusted household staff.
* Pepe Herrera as Dindo, Jethro's friend and business partner.

# Production

## Development

The series was first announced in 2021, with Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla attached to star. The show was produced by Dreamscape Entertainment, a subsidiary of ABS-CBN Corporation.

## Filming

The series was filmed on location in Paris, France, and in various locations in the Philippines. The show's production team worked closely with French authorities to ensure that the show was filmed in accordance with local regulations.

## Music

The show's theme song, "2 Good 2 Be True," was performed by KZ Tandingan and TJ Monterde.

# Reception

## Ratings

The series premiered to high ratings, with its pilot episode ranking as the number one show in its time slot.

## Critical Response

The show received generally positive reviews from critics, who praised the chemistry between the lead actors and the show's engaging storyline.

# Release

## Broadcast

The series premiered on May 13, 2022, on Kapamilya Channel and A2Z.

## Streaming

The show was also available to stream on Viu and iWantTFC.

# Spin-off

A spin-off series, "2 Good 2 Be True: The Wedding," was announced in 2022. The series will follow the story of Erika and Jethro's wedding and will feature the same cast.

# See Also

* Lovers in Paris (2003 South Korean television series)
* Lovers in Paris (2004 Philippine television series)
* KathNiel (Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla's love team)

# Notes

This article uses material from the Wikipedia article "2 Good 2 Be True," which is released under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.

# References

article:
Chris Hipkins

Christopher John Hipkins, commonly known as Chris Hipkins, is a New Zealand politician who has served as the Prime Minister of New Zealand since January 2023. He has been a member of the Labour Party and has represented the Rimutaka electorate in the House of Representatives since 2008.

#Early life

Chris Hipkins was born on 5 September 1978 in Hutt Valley, New Zealand. He grew up in the suburb of Waterloo, Lower Hutt, and was educated at Waterloo Primary School and Hutt Valley High School. Hipkins developed an interest in politics at a young age, inspired by his parents' involvement in local community groups. He joined the Labour Party while still at high school and quickly became involved in local party activities.

After completing his secondary education, Hipkins attended Victoria University of Wellington, where he studied politics and criminology. During his time at university, he was involved in student politics and served as the president of the Victoria University of Wellington Students' Association. After graduating, Hipkins worked as a policy advisor for the New Zealand Police and later as a senior advisor to the Minister of Education.

#In Opposition, 2008–2017

##Standing as a parliamentary candidate (2008)

In 2008, Hipkins was selected as the Labour Party's candidate for the Rimutaka electorate. He won the seat in the 2008 general election, defeating the incumbent National Party MP, Paul Swain. Hipkins' victory was seen as a significant upset, as the National Party had held the seat for over 20 years.

##First term (2008–2011)

During his first term in parliament, Hipkins served as a member of the Labour Party's frontbench. He was appointed as the party's spokesperson for Internal Affairs and was also a member of the Education and Science select committee. Hipkins quickly established himself as a skilled and effective debater, earning a reputation as one of the Labour Party's most promising young MPs.

##Second term (2011–2014)

In the 2011 general election, Hipkins was re-elected as the MP for Rimutaka, increasing his majority over the National Party candidate. During his second term, Hipkins continued to serve as a member of the Labour Party's frontbench, taking on additional responsibilities as the party's spokesperson for Education.

##Third term (2014–2017)

In the 2014 general election, Hipkins was re-elected for a third term as the MP for Rimutaka. During this period, he continued to serve as the Labour Party's spokesperson for Education, playing a key role in the party's opposition to the National Party's education policies.

#In Government (2017–2023)

##Fourth term (2017–2020)

In the 2017 general election, the Labour Party, led by Jacinda Ardern, formed a coalition government with the New Zealand First Party and the Green Party. Hipkins was appointed as the Minister of Education and the Minister for the Public Service. As Education Minister, Hipkins oversaw a major overhaul of the education system, including the introduction of new curriculum standards and a significant increase in funding for schools.

##Fifth term (2020–2023)

In the 2020 general election, the Labour Party won a landslide victory, securing a majority of seats in the House of Representatives. Hipkins was re-elected as the MP for Rimutaka and continued to serve as the Minister of Education and the Minister for the Public Service. During this period, he played a key role in the government's response to the COVID-19 pandemic, overseeing the development and implementation of the country's vaccination program.

#Prime Minister (2023)

##Nomination and appointment

In January 2023, Jacinda Ardern announced her resignation as Prime Minister, citing a desire to spend more time with her family. Hipkins was subsequently nominated as her successor by the Labour Party caucus and was sworn in as the Prime Minister of New Zealand on 25 January 2023.

##Domestic affairs

As Prime Minister, Hipkins has continued to focus on the key policy areas that he worked on as Minister of Education, including education reform and public service modernization. He has also taken a strong stance on issues such as climate change and economic inequality, committing to significant investments in renewable energy and social welfare programs.

##Foreign affairs

Hipkins has continued to maintain New Zealand's strong relationships with key international partners, including Australia, the United States, and the European Union. He has also taken a strong stance on issues such as human rights and disarmament, committing to continued support for international efforts to promote peace and stability.

##2023 general election

Hipkins will face his first general election as Prime Minister in 2023. The election is expected to be closely contested, with the National Party and other opposition parties seeking to capitalize on any perceived weaknesses in the government's performance. Hipkins has promised to run a positive campaign, focusing on the government's achievements and its vision for the future.

#In Opposition (2023–present)

As of the time of writing, Hipkins is still serving as the Prime Minister of New Zealand. However, the outcome of the 2023 general election is uncertain, and it is possible that he may find himself in opposition in the future. If this occurs, Hipkins is likely to remain a prominent figure in New Zealand politics, continuing to advocate for the policies and values that he has championed throughout his career.

#Political views

Hipkins is a member of the Labour Party and has consistently identified as a center-left politician. He has expressed strong support for social democracy and has advocated for policies such as greater investment in public services, progressive taxation, and stronger labor laws.

#Public image

Hipkins has a reputation as a competent and effective politician. He is widely respected for his intelligence, his work ethic, and his commitment to public service. However, he has also faced criticism for his handling of certain policy issues, including education reform and the government's response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

#Personal life

Hipkins is married to Jade Hipkins, and the couple has two children together. He is a keen sports fan and enjoys playing golf and watching rugby in his free time. Hipkins is also a talented musician and has been known to play the guitar at social events.

Football at the 2022 Asian Games – Men's tournament

The men's football tournament at the 2022 Asian Games was held in Hangzhou, China, from September 19 to October 7, 2023. The tournament featured 23 teams from across Asia, competing for the gold medal.

Competition schedule

The competition schedule for the men's football tournament at the 2022 Asian Games was announced in August 2023. The tournament began on September 19, 2023, and concluded on October 7, 2023. The group stage matches were played from September 19 to 28, 2023, followed by the knockout stage matches from October 1 to 7, 2023.

Venues

The men's football tournament at the 2022 Asian Games was held at six venues in Hangzhou, China:

* Hangzhou Dalianyuan Stadium
* Hangzhou Linping Sports Center Stadium
* Jinhua Stadium
* Lin'an Stadium
* Shaoxing City Sports Centre Stadium
* Wenzhou Stadium

Draw

The draw for the men's football tournament at the 2022 Asian Games was held on July 27, 2023, in Hangzhou, China. The 23 teams were divided into six groups of three teams each, with the top two teams from each group qualifying for the knockout stage.

Squads

Each team was required to submit a squad of 20 players for the tournament. The squads were announced in August 2023.

Referees

The referees for the men's football tournament at the 2022 Asian Games were announced in August 2023. A total of 25 referees from across Asia were selected to officiate the matches.

Group stage

The group stage matches were played from September 19 to 28, 2023. The top two teams from each group qualified for the knockout stage.

Tiebreakers

In the event of a tie between two or more teams in the group stage, the following tiebreakers were used:

* Points earned in the matches between the tied teams
* Goal difference in the matches between the tied teams
* Goals scored in the matches between the tied teams
* Goal difference in all group stage matches

2023–24 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round

The 2023–24 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round will determine the remaining teams that will join the 26 teams that directly qualify for the group stage of the 2023–24 UEFA Champions League.

# Teams

A total of 53 teams from 54 UEFA member associations will participate in the qualifying phase and play-off round. The association ranking based on the UEFA coefficients is used to determine the number of participating teams.

## Champions Path

The Champions Path will feature 43 teams that are champions of their respective associations, except for the top four associations (Spain, England, Germany, and Italy), which will have their champions directly qualify for the group stage. The teams will compete in a series of knockout rounds to determine the teams that will advance to the play-off round.

## League Path

The League Path will feature 10 teams that are not champions of their respective associations, but have qualified for the Champions League based on their league position. These teams will compete in a series of knockout rounds to determine the teams that will advance to the play-off round.

# Format

The qualifying phase and play-off round will consist of four rounds: the preliminary round, the first qualifying round, the second qualifying round, and the third qualifying round. The winners of the third qualifying round will advance to the play-off round.

# Schedule

* Preliminary round: June 2023
* First qualifying round: July 2023
* Second qualifying round: July 2023

article:
History of Fantasy

Fantasy is a literary and artistic genre that has evolved over time, shaped by various cultural, social, and historical factors. While the concept of fantasy has been present in human imagination throughout history, the modern notion of fantasy as a distinct genre has developed over the past few centuries. This article explores the history of fantasy, tracing its evolution from ancient mythologies to modern-day fiction.

# Differences between fantasy and earlier fantastic works

Fantasy, as a genre, is distinct from earlier forms of fantastic literature, such as mythology, folklore, and fairy tales. While these earlier forms often featured supernatural or magical elements, they were typically presented as factual accounts or explanations of natural phenomena. In contrast, fantasy fiction is characterized by its deliberate departure from reality, often creating entirely new worlds, creatures, and rules.

Moreover, fantasy fiction frequently employs a narrative structure that is distinct from earlier forms of storytelling. Fantasy stories often feature quests, heroes, and villains, and are typically set in imaginary worlds with their own geography, history, and mythology. This distinctive narrative structure sets fantasy apart from earlier forms of fantastic literature, which were often more focused on conveying moral or cultural values.

# Development of fantasy

The development of fantasy as a genre can be broadly divided into several key periods, each characterized by significant cultural, social, and literary trends.

## Romances

During the Middle Ages, the romance genre emerged as a major literary force. Romances were long, narrative poems that often featured magical or supernatural elements, such as the works of Chrétien de Troyes or Sir Thomas Malory's Le Morte d'Arthur. While not strictly fantasy in the modern sense, these works laid the groundwork for the development of fantasy as a genre.

Romances frequently featured heroic quests, magical creatures, and enchanted landscapes, all of which would become staples of the fantasy genre. Moreover, the romance genre's emphasis on chivalry, honor, and courtly love helped to shape the moral and social values that would underpin many fantasy stories.

## The Enlightenment

The Enlightenment, which spanned the 17th and 18th centuries, saw a significant shift in the way people thought about the world. As scientific inquiry and rationalism gained prominence, many writers began to explore the possibilities of rational, scientific explanations for natural phenomena. This led to a decline in the popularity of supernatural or magical themes in literature.

However, the Enlightenment also saw the emergence of new literary forms, such as the philosophical novel and the utopian tale. Works like Jonathan Swift's Gulliver's Travels or Voltaire's Candide employed satire and social commentary to explore the human condition, often incorporating fantastical elements in the process.

## Romanticism

The Romantic movement, which spanned the late 18th and early 19th centuries, saw a resurgence of interest in the supernatural, the irrational, and the emotional. Romantic writers like Samuel Taylor Coleridge, Lord Byron, and Percy Bysshe Shelley explored the possibilities of fantasy and the sublime, often incorporating elements of folklore, mythology, and fairy tales into their work.

Romanticism's emphasis on the individual, the emotional, and the irrational helped to create a fertile ground for the development of fantasy as a genre. Moreover, the Romantic movement's focus on the beauty and power of nature helped to shape the fantasy genre's emphasis on landscapes, environments, and the natural world.

# Modern fantasy

The modern fantasy genre, as we know it today, emerged in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

## Pre-Tolkien

Before the publication of J.R.R. Tolkien's The Hobbit in 1937, fantasy fiction was largely dominated by the likes of George MacDonald, William Morris, and Lord Dunsany. These writers helped to shape the fantasy genre, exploring themes of mythology, folklore, and fairy tales.

However, it was not until the early 20th century that fantasy began to emerge as a distinct genre, with writers like H.P. Lovecraft, Clark Ashton Smith, and Robert E. Howard creating new and innovative works of fantasy fiction.

## Tolkien

J.R.R. Tolkien's The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings are widely regarded as the foundational texts of modern fantasy. Tolkien's work drew heavily on his love of mythology, languages, and history, creating a richly detailed and immersive world that has captivated readers for generations.

Tolkien's influence on the fantasy genre cannot be overstated. His work helped to establish the fantasy genre as a major literary force, and his influence can be seen in countless other authors, from C.S. Lewis to George R.R. Martin.

## Post-Tolkien

In the decades following Tolkien's publication of The Lord of the Rings, the fantasy genre continued to evolve and diversify. Writers like Ursula K. Le Guin, Terry Pratchett, and Neil Gaiman helped to push the boundaries of the genre, exploring new themes, styles, and sub-genres.

The rise of fantasy fiction in the latter half of the 20th century was also accompanied by the emergence of new sub-genres, such as epic fantasy, urban fantasy, and fantasy of manners. Moreover, the fantasy genre has continued to intersect with other genres, such as science fiction, horror, and historical fiction.

# References

## Further reading

* Attebery, Brian. The Fantasy Tradition in American Literature. Indiana University Press, 1980.
* Brennan, Timothy. Salman Rushdie and the Third World: Myths of the Nation. Macmillan, 1989.
* Clute, John, and John Grant. The Encyclopedia of Fantasy. Orbit, 1997.
* Frye, Northrop. The Anatomy of Criticism: Four Essays. Princeton University Press, 1957.
* Jackson, Rosemary. Fantasy: The Literature of Subversion. Methuen, 1981.
* Manlove, C.N. Modern Fantasy: Five Studies. Cambridge University Press, 1975.
* Moorcock, Michael. Wizardry and Wild Romance: A Study of Epic Fantasy. Gollancz, 1987.

World Baseball Classic
=====================

The World Baseball Classic (WBC) is an international baseball tournament sanctioned by the World Baseball Softball Confederation (WBSC) and organized by the World Baseball Classic Inc. The tournament features national teams from around the world, competing in a knockout format to determine the world champion. The WBC is considered the premier international baseball competition, rivaling the Olympic Games in terms of prestige and popularity.

Background
----------

The idea of a global baseball tournament dates back to the 1990s, when the International Baseball Federation (IBAF) proposed a world championship event. However, it wasn't until 2005 that the WBC was officially announced, with the inaugural tournament scheduled for 2006. The WBC was created to promote baseball worldwide, increase its popularity, and provide a platform for national teams to compete against each other.

History
-------

### 2006–09: Samurai Japan's back-to-back championships

The first WBC took place in March 2006, featuring 16 national teams divided into four groups. Japan, led by manager Sadaharu Oh, won the inaugural tournament, defeating Cuba 10-6 in the final. Japan repeated as champions in 2009, defeating South Korea 5-3 in the final. The 2006 and 2009 tournaments were notable for their high level of competition, with many of the world's top players participating.

### 2013: Direct qualification and "Plátano Power"

The 2013 WBC introduced a new qualification system, where the top 12 teams from the previous tournament qualified directly, while the remaining four spots were filled through a qualifying tournament. The Dominican Republic won its first WBC title, defeating Puerto Rico 3-0 in the final. The tournament was marked by the emergence of "Plátano Power," a nickname given to the Dominican team's powerful offense.

### 2017: American redemption

The 2017 WBC saw the United States win its first title, defeating Puerto Rico 8-0 in the final. The American team, led by manager Jim Leyland, featured a star-studded roster, including Giancarlo Stanton, Mike Trout, and Andrew McCutchen. The tournament was notable for its high-scoring games and exciting finishes.

### 2023: "Baseball's already won"

The 2023 WBC took place in March 2023, featuring a new format with 20 national teams competing in five groups. Japan won its third WBC title, defeating the United States 3-2 in the final. The tournament was marked by a sense of unity and sportsmanship, with many players and teams expressing their appreciation for the opportunity to compete.

### 2026 tournament

The 2026 WBC is scheduled to take place in March 2026, with 20 national teams competing in five groups. The tournament will feature a new format, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the knockout stage.

Format
-------

The WBC features a knockout format, where teams compete in a series of games to determine the champion. The tournament typically begins with a round-robin group stage, where teams play each other once. The top two teams from each group advance to the knockout stage, where they compete in a single-elimination format.

Participation
------------

The WBC features national teams from around the world, with a total of 20 teams competing in the 2023 tournament. The teams are divided into five groups, with four teams in each group. The top 12 teams from the previous tournament qualify directly, while the remaining eight spots are filled through a qualifying tournament.

Trophy
------

The WBC trophy is awarded to the winning team, and it is considered one of the most prestigious awards in international baseball. The trophy is a symbol of excellence and achievement, and it is highly coveted by teams and players around the world.

Broadcasting and promotion
------------------------

The WBC is broadcast in over 200 countries and territories around the world, with a global audience of millions. The tournament is promoted through a variety of channels, including social media, television, and online streaming.

Attendance
----------

The WBC has consistently high attendance figures, with many games selling out in advance. The tournament is popular among fans, who appreciate the opportunity to see their national team compete against the best teams in the world.

Venues
-------

The WBC is played in a variety of venues around the world, including baseball stadiums, arenas, and outdoor facilities. The tournament typically features a mix of established and new venues, providing a unique and exciting experience for fans.

Results
-------

### Performance of nations

The WBC has been dominated by a few top teams, including Japan, the United States, and the Dominican Republic. These teams have consistently performed well, with Japan winning three titles and the United States winning one.

### Debut of national teams

The WBC has provided a platform for new national teams to compete against established teams. Many teams have made their debut in the WBC, including Israel, Italy, and the Netherlands.

### Overview

The WBC has been a success, providing a platform for national teams to compete against each other. The tournament has grown in popularity, with increasing attendance and viewership figures.

Honors

### Most Valuable Player

The Most Valuable Player award is given to the best player in the WBC. The award is considered one of the most prestigious individual honors in international baseball.

### All-WBC teams

article:
Free Substitution

Free substitution refers to the practice in various sports of allowing players to be replaced by others during a game, either with or without restrictions. This concept has been adopted in different forms across various sports, with some allowing unlimited substitutions, while others impose limitations on the number of substitutions or the circumstances under which they can occur.

# Sports that allow free substitution

## Sports that allow unlimited substitution during live play

In some sports, teams are allowed to make substitutions freely during live play, without any restrictions on the number of substitutions or the timing of when they can occur. Examples of sports that allow unlimited substitution during live play include:

* Ice hockey: In ice hockey, teams are allowed to make line changes on the fly, with players substituting in and out of the game during live play.
* Lacrosse: Similar to ice hockey, lacrosse teams are also allowed to make substitutions during live play, with players entering and exiting the game as needed.
* Field hockey: Field hockey teams are allowed to make substitutions during live play, with players substituting in and out of the game without restrictions.

These sports typically feature high-intensity, fast-paced action, and the ability to make substitutions freely allows teams to keep fresh players on the field and maintain a high level of performance.

## Sports that allow unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play only

In other sports, teams are allowed to make unlimited substitutions, but only during stoppages of play. This means that substitutions can only be made when the game is not in progress, such as during timeouts, between periods, or during other interruptions in play. Examples of sports that allow unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play only include:

* Basketball: In basketball, teams are allowed to make substitutions during timeouts, between quarters, and during other stoppages of play.
* Football: Football teams are allowed to make substitutions during timeouts, between plays, and during other stoppages of play.
* Volleyball: Volleyball teams are allowed to make substitutions during timeouts, between sets, and during other stoppages of play.

These sports typically feature more structured gameplay, with more frequent interruptions in play, and the ability to make substitutions during stoppages of play allows teams to make strategic decisions about player deployment.

# Sports with limited substitution

## Sports that allow a limited number of substitutions

In some sports, teams are allowed to make a limited number of substitutions, either per game or per half. This means that teams must carefully manage their substitutions, as they are limited in the number of changes they can make. Examples of sports that allow a limited number of substitutions include:

* Soccer: In soccer, teams are allowed to make three substitutions per game, with some exceptions for injuries and red cards.
* Rugby: Rugby teams are allowed to make a limited number of substitutions, typically seven or eight per game, depending on the specific competition.
* Cricket: Cricket teams are allowed to make a limited number of substitutions, typically two or three per game, depending on the specific competition.

These sports typically require teams to carefully manage their resources, as the limited number of substitutions means that teams must be strategic about when and how they make changes to their lineup.

## Sports that only allow substitution to replace injured players

In some sports, substitutions are only allowed in the event of an injury to a player. This means that teams are not allowed to make tactical substitutions, and any substitutions that are made must be due to a legitimate injury to a player. Examples of sports that only allow substitution to replace injured players include:

* Baseball: In baseball, substitutions are only allowed in the event of an injury to a player, with some exceptions for pinch-hitting and defensive replacements.
* Softball: Softball teams are only allowed to make substitutions in the event of an injury to a player.
* Golf: Golfers are not allowed to make substitutions, as each player must complete the round on their own.

These sports typically place a high premium on individual performance, and the limited substitution rules mean that teams must rely on their players to perform at a high level throughout the competition.

# Sports with mixed or hybrid systems

Some sports feature mixed or hybrid systems, which combine elements of different substitution rules. For example:

* American football: American football teams are allowed to make unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play, but are also allowed to make limited substitutions during live play, such as when a player is injured.
* Water polo: Water polo teams are allowed to make unlimited substitutions during live play, but are also required to make substitutions through a designated substitution area.

These sports typically feature complex rules and regulations, and the mixed or hybrid substitution systems reflect the unique demands and challenges of each sport.

# See also

* Substitution (sports)
* Timeout (sports)
* Injury (sports)

# Notes

This article provides an overview of the different substitution rules and systems used in various sports. The rules and regulations governing substitution can vary significantly from one sport to another, and this article aims to provide a comprehensive and informative guide to the different approaches used in different sports.

Night of Champions (2023)

Night of Champions was a professional wrestling event produced by WWE, a global entertainment company. It took place on October 14, 2023, at the Coliseo de Puerto Rico in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The event was the 17th annual Night of Champions, a pay-per-view (PPV) event that features WWE's top superstars competing for various championships.

# Production

## Background

The event was announced in June 2023, with tickets going on sale shortly after. The Coliseo de Puerto Rico, a state-of-the-art arena in San Juan, Puerto Rico, was chosen as the venue for the event. This marked the first time WWE had held a PPV event in Puerto Rico since Backlash in 2005.

## Storylines

The event featured several storylines, including the ongoing feud between Roman Reigns and Seth Rollins for the Undisputed WWE Universal Championship. Other notable feuds included the rivalry between Bianca Belair and Rhea Ripley for the Raw Women's Championship, and the struggle for control of the SmackDown Tag Team Championship between The Usos and The New Day.

# Event

The event began with a live pre-show, featuring a match between Ricochet and Sami Zayn for a spot in the World Heavyweight Championship Tournament. The match ended with Ricochet emerging victorious, earning his place in the tournament.

## Preliminary matches

The first match of the main card saw The New Day face off against The Usos for the SmackDown Tag Team Championship. The New Day emerged victorious, capturing the titles and ending The Usos' record-breaking reign. Next, Rhea Ripley defended her Raw Women's Championship against Bianca Belair in a highly competitive match. Ripley ultimately retained her title, thanks in part to interference from her Judgment Day stablemates.

The following match saw the beginning of the World Heavyweight Championship Tournament, with four superstars competing in a fatal four-way match to determine the first semifinalist. The match ended with Cody Rhodes emerging victorious, advancing to the semifinals.

## Main event

The main event of the evening saw Roman Reigns defend his Undisputed WWE Universal Championship against Seth Rollins. The match was highly intense, with both superstars giving it their all. In the end, Reigns emerged victorious, retaining his title and solidifying his position as the top champion in WWE.

# Reception

The event received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the high-quality matches and strong storytelling. The event was also a commercial success, with a reported attendance of over 18,000 fans at the Coliseo de Puerto Rico.

# Aftermath

## Raw

The following Monday on Raw, Rhea Ripley celebrated her successful title defense with a victory speech. However, her celebration was cut short by the arrival of Bianca Belair, who challenged Ripley to a rematch. The match was scheduled for the following week's Raw, with the winner advancing to a number one contender's match for the Raw Women's Championship.

## SmackDown

On the following Friday's SmackDown, The New Day celebrated their SmackDown Tag Team Championship win with a victory speech. However, their celebration was cut short by the arrival of The Usos, who challenged The New Day to a rematch. The match was scheduled for the following week's SmackDown, with the winner retaining the titles.

article:
Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective
==========================

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective is a puzzle-adventure game developed and published by Capcom. The game was released in 2010 for the Nintendo DS and has since become a cult classic. It is known for its unique gameplay mechanics, engaging storyline, and memorable characters.

Gameplay
--------

In Ghost Trick, players take on the role of Sissel, a ghost who is trying to solve the mystery of his own death. The game is divided into chapters, each of which represents a different day in the story. Players must use Sissel's ghostly abilities to interact with the environment and characters, and to solve puzzles that allow him to progress through the story.

One of the unique features of Ghost Trick is its "trick" system. Sissel can possess and manipulate objects in the environment, using them to solve puzzles or affect the actions of characters. For example, he might possess a ladder to use it to reach a high platform, or possess a character's phone to receive important information.

Players can also use Sissel's "ghost trick" ability to rewind time and try again if they make a mistake. This allows for a high degree of experimentation and trial-and-error, as players can try different solutions to puzzles without fear of penalty.

Plot
-----

The story of Ghost Trick follows Sissel, a ghost who is trying to solve the mystery of his own death. With the help of a young girl named Lynne, Sissel sets out to uncover the truth behind his own demise.

As the game progresses, Sissel and Lynne become embroiled in a complex web of intrigue and deception. They must navigate a cast of characters who are not always what they seem, and who may be hiding secrets of their own.

Throughout the game, Sissel and Lynne encounter a range of characters who are connected to Sissel's past. There is Kamila, a mysterious woman who seems to know more about Sissel than she is letting on; Detective Jowd, a gruff but lovable investigator who is trying to solve a series of murders; and Ray, a young boy who is somehow connected to Sissel's past.

As the story unfolds, Sissel and Lynne uncover a complex plot that involves murder, betrayal, and deception. They must use all of their skills and abilities to stay one step ahead of the villains and uncover the truth.

Development
------------

Ghost Trick was developed by a team at Capcom, led by director Shu Takumi. Takumi is best known for his work on the Ace Attorney series, and he brought many of the same elements that made that series successful to Ghost Trick.

### Art and game design

The art style of Ghost Trick is distinctive and memorable. The game features a range of colorful, cartoon-like characters, each with their own unique personality and design. The environments are also highly detailed, with a range of interactive objects and puzzles to solve.

The game's design is centered around the "trick" system, which allows players to possess and manipulate objects in the environment. This system is used to solve puzzles, affect the actions of characters, and progress through the story.

### Music and sound design

The music and sound design of Ghost Trick are also noteworthy. The game features a range of catchy, memorable themes, each of which is associated with a particular character or location. The sound effects are also highly detailed, with a range of realistic sounds that help to bring the game world to life.

Release

article:
2023 SAG-AFTRA Strike

The 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike was a labor dispute between the Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) and the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers (AMPTP), which represents the major film and television studios in the United States. The strike, which began on July 14, 2023, was the first major labor action by SAG-AFTRA in over 40 years and had significant implications for the film and television industry.

# Background

## Unionization in Hollywood

The history of unionization in Hollywood dates back to the early 20th century, when actors, writers, and directors began organizing to improve their working conditions and compensation. The Screen Actors Guild (SAG) was founded in 1933, and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA) was established in 1937. The two unions merged in 2012 to form SAG-AFTRA, which represents over 160,000 film and television actors, journalists, radio personalities, recording artists, singers, and other media professionals.

## Pre-strike activity

In the months leading up to the strike, SAG-AFTRA and the AMPTP engaged in tense negotiations over a new collective bargaining agreement. The union sought significant increases in compensation and benefits for its members, as well as improved working conditions and greater protections against the use of artificial intelligence and other technologies that could potentially replace human actors. The AMPTP, which represents the major studios, was resistant to many of these demands, citing concerns about the economic impact of the proposed changes.

# Timeline

## July

The 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike began on July 14, 2023, after negotiations between the union and the AMPTP broke down. The strike was authorized by a vote of the SAG-AFTRA membership, with over 98% of members supporting the action. The strike affected film and television production across the United States, with many projects shutting down or being delayed.

## August

In August, the strike showed no signs of ending, with both sides dug in and refusing to budge. The AMPTP launched a public relations campaign aimed at portraying the union as unreasonable and greedy, while SAG-AFTRA countered with its own campaign highlighting the struggles of its members and the need for fair compensation and working conditions.

## September

In September, the strike began to have a significant impact on the film and television industry, with many projects facing delays or cancellations. The Emmys, one of the most prestigious awards ceremonies in the industry, were also affected, with many nominees and presenters refusing to cross the picket line.

## October

In October, the strike entered its third month, with no end in sight. The AMPTP began to feel the economic impact of the strike, with many studios facing significant losses. SAG-AFTRA, however, remained resolute, with its members continuing to hold firm on their demands.

## November

In November, the strike took a dramatic turn, with the Writers Guild of America (WGA) announcing its support for SAG-AFTRA and threatening to join the strike if its own negotiations with the AMPTP broke down. The WGA, which represents writers in the film and television industry, had been watching the SAG-AFTRA strike closely and was sympathetic to the union's demands.

## December

In December, the strike finally came to an end, with SAG-AFTRA and the AMPTP reaching a tentative agreement on a new collective bargaining agreement. The agreement included many of the concessions that SAG-AFTRA had been seeking, including increased compensation and benefits for its members, as well as improved working conditions and greater protections against the use of artificial intelligence and other technologies.

# Strike activity and responses

## Locations

The 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike was a national strike, with picket lines and rallies taking place in cities across the United States. The strike was particularly active in Los Angeles and New York, where many of the major film and television studios are located.

## Media executives' response

The response of media executives to the strike was largely negative, with many portraying the union as unreasonable and greedy. The AMPTP, which represents the major studios, launched a public relations campaign aimed at undermining the union's demands and portraying the strike as unnecessary and economically damaging.

## Politicians' response

Many politicians, including some in the California state legislature and the U.S. Congress, expressed support for the strike and the union's demands. Some politicians, however, were more neutral, calling for both sides to negotiate in good faith and reach a fair agreement.

## Other unions' response

The response of other unions to the strike was largely supportive, with many unions expressing solidarity with SAG-AFTRA and its members. The WGA, which represents writers in the film and television industry, was particularly supportive, threatening to join the strike if its own negotiations with the AMPTP broke down.

## Other organizations' response

Many other organizations, including some in the film and television industry, expressed support for the strike and the union's demands. Some organizations, however, were more neutral, calling for both sides to negotiate in good faith and reach a fair agreement.

## Impact

The 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike had a significant impact on the film and television industry, with many projects facing delays or cancellations. The strike also had a significant economic impact, with many studios facing significant losses. The strike, however, ultimately resulted in a new collective bargaining agreement that included many of the concessions that SAG-AFTRA had been seeking.

# Aftermath

The aftermath of the 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike was marked by a sense of relief and accomplishment, with many in the film and television industry hailing the new collective bargaining agreement as a major victory for SAG-AFTRA and its members. The strike, however, also highlighted the ongoing challenges facing the industry, including the increasing use of artificial intelligence and other technologies that could potentially replace human actors.

article:
George Gordon Meade
================

George Gordon Meade was a career military officer and civil engineer who served as a general in the Union Army during the American Civil War. He is best known for his victory at the Battle of Gettysburg, which repelled the second invasion of the North by the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia, led by General Robert E. Lee.

Early Life and Education
------------------------

Meade was born on December 31, 1815, in Cádiz, Spain, to Richard Worsam Meade and Margaret Coats Butler Meade. His father was a wealthy merchant who had business interests in Spain. Meade was the first of seven children, and his family moved back to the United States when he was a young child. They settled in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, where Meade spent most of his childhood.

Meade attended the Mount Hope Institution in Baltimore, Maryland, and later graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point in 1835. He was commissioned as a brevet second lieutenant in the United States Army Corps of Engineers.

Topographical Corps and Mexican-American War
--------------------------------------------

Meade served in the Topographical Corps, where he was involved in the surveying and mapping of the United States. He worked on the survey of the Delaware River, the Philadelphia and Columbia Railroad, and the Alabama River.

During the Mexican-American War, Meade served as a lieutenant in the Corps of Engineers. He was involved in the siege of Veracruz and the Battle of Chapultepec, where he was brevetted to captain. Meade's service in the war was marked by his bravery and technical expertise.

American Civil War
-----------------

Meade's service in the Civil War began in 1861, when he was appointed as a brigadier general of volunteers. He served in the Department of Pennsylvania, where he was responsible for organizing and training troops.

### Peninsula Campaign

In 1862, Meade was assigned to the Army of the Potomac, where he served as a division commander in the V Corps. He was involved in the Peninsula Campaign, where he led his division in the Battle of Mechanicsville and the Seven Days Battles. Meade was wounded in the Battle of Mechanicsville, but he continued to serve despite his injury.

### Maryland Campaign

In the fall of 1862, Meade served in the Maryland Campaign, where he led his division in the Battle of South Mountain and the Battle of Antietam. Although the battle was tactically inconclusive, it gave President Abraham Lincoln the opportunity to issue the Emancipation Proclamation.

### Fredericksburg and Chancellorsville

In December 1862, Meade's division was involved in the Battle of Fredericksburg, where they suffered heavy casualties. In the spring of 1863, Meade served in the Chancellorsville Campaign, where he led his division in the Battle of Chancellorsville. Although the Confederate Army won a tactical victory, they suffered heavy casualties, including the loss of General Stonewall Jackson.

### Gettysburg Campaign

#### Command of the Army of the Potomac

In June 1863, Meade was appointed as the commander of the Army of the Potomac, replacing General Joseph Hooker. Meade's appointment was unexpected, and he had only a few days to prepare for the invasion of Pennsylvania by the Confederate Army.

#### Battle of Gettysburg

The Battle of Gettysburg was fought from July 1 to July 3, 1863. Meade's army was initially pushed back through the town of Gettysburg, but they were able to regroup and form a defensive line on Cemetery Ridge. On the second day of the battle, the Confederate Army launched a massive assault on the Union positions, but they were repelled with heavy casualties. On the third day of the battle, the Confederate Army launched a final assault, known as Pickett's Charge, which was also repelled.

#### Lee's Retreat

After the Battle of Gettysburg, Meade's army pursued the Confederate Army as they retreated back to Virginia. Although Meade was criticized for not being more aggressive in his pursuit, he was able to keep the Confederate Army on the run and prevent them from launching another invasion of the North.

### Bristoe and Mine Run Campaign

In the fall of 1863, Meade served in the Bristoe and Mine Run Campaigns, where he led his army in a series of battles against the Confederate Army. Although the campaign was tactically inconclusive, Meade was able to keep the Confederate Army off balance and prevent them from launching another invasion of the North.

### Overland Campaign

In 1864, Meade served in the Overland Campaign, where he led his army in a series of battles against the Confederate Army. The campaign was marked by heavy casualties on both sides, but Meade was able to keep the Confederate Army on the run and prevent them from launching another invasion of the North.

### Richmond-Petersburg Campaign

In the summer of 1864, Meade served in the Richmond-Petersburg Campaign, where he led his army in a series of battles against the Confederate Army. Although the campaign was tactically inconclusive, Meade was able to keep the Confederate Army pinned down and prevent them from launching another invasion of the North.

### Political Rivalries

Meade's service in the Civil War was marked by his rivalries with other generals, including General Ulysses S. Grant and General William Tecumseh Sherman. Meade was also involved in a series of controversies with politicians, including President Abraham Lincoln and Secretary of War Edwin Stanton.

Reconstruction
-------------

After the Civil War, Meade served as the military governor of the Third Military District, which included the states of Georgia, Alabama, and Florida. He was involved in the Reconstruction of the South and worked to ensure that the rights of freed slaves were protected.

Personal Life
-------------

Meade was married to Margaret Sergeant Meade, and they had seven children together. He was a member of the Episcopal Church and was known for his strong sense of morality and justice.

Later Life and Death
--------------------

Meade died on November 6, 1872, at the age of 56, due to complications from pneumonia. He was buried in Laurel Hill Cemetery in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.

Legacy
--------

Meade's legacy is that of a hero of the Civil War, who played a crucial role in the Union victory. He is remembered for his bravery and technical expertise, and his leadership at the Battle of Gettysburg.

### Memorials to Meade

There are several memorials to Meade, including the Meade Memorial in Washington, D.C., which was dedicated in 1927. There are also several statues of Meade in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.

In Popular Culture

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law
==========================

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law is an American television series created by Jessica Gao for the streaming service Disney+. It is based on the Marvel Comics character She-Hulk, a lawyer who gains superhuman strength after receiving a blood transfusion from her cousin, Bruce Banner. The series is set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and follows the story of Jennifer Walters, a talented lawyer who must navigate her personal and professional life as a superpowered being.

Premise
--------

The series follows Jennifer Walters, a successful lawyer who is also the cousin of Bruce Banner, aka the Hulk. After a car accident, Jennifer receives a blood transfusion from Bruce, which gives her superhuman strength and durability. As she navigates her new powers, Jennifer must also deal with the challenges of being a lawyer, including her demanding boss, her rival lawyers, and her own self-doubt. Along the way, she must also confront supervillains, including the Abomination, and learn to balance her personal and professional life.

2022 French Presidential Election

The 2022 French presidential election was held on 10 April (first round) and 24 April (second round) to elect the President of France. The incumbent president, Emmanuel Macron, sought re-election, facing a diverse field of candidates from various political backgrounds.

#Electoral System

The French presidential election uses a two-round system. In the first round, voters cast ballots for their preferred candidate. If no candidate receives an absolute majority (more than 50% of the total vote), a second round is held between the top two candidates from the first round. The candidate with the most votes in the second round is elected president.

#First Round

##Campaign

The first round campaign saw a wide range of candidates competing for the presidency. The campaign focused on issues such as the economy, immigration, and the European Union. Candidates also debated on topics like climate change, healthcare, and education.

##Primaries and Congresses

Several parties held primaries or congresses to select their candidates for the presidential election.

###Ecologist Primary

The ecologist primary, held in September 2021, saw several candidates vying for the nomination. The primary was won by Yannick Jadot, a member of the European Parliament.

###Socialist Primary

The Socialist Party held a primary in January 2022, which was won by Anne Hidalgo, the Mayor of Paris.

###People's Primary

The People's Primary, a citizen-led initiative, was held in January 2022. The primary was won by Christiane Taubira, a former Minister of Justice.

###The Republicans Congress

The Republicans, a center-right party, held a congress in December 2021 to select their candidate. The congress was won by Valérie Pécresse, a former Minister of Higher Education.

##Candidates

A total of 12 candidates competed in the first round of the presidential election.

###Sponsorships

To be eligible to run in the election, candidates needed to collect 500 signatures from elected officials. These signatures, known as sponsorships, were a requirement for candidacy.

##Electorate

The electorate for the presidential election consisted of all French citizens aged 18 and above who were registered to vote. The voter turnout for the first round was approximately 73%.

#Second Round

##Campaign

2022 US Open – Women's singles qualifying

The 2022 US Open Women's Singles Qualifying was a series of tennis matches that took place from August 23 to August 26, 2022, at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing Meadows, Queens, New York City, United States. It was the qualifying competition for the 2022 US Open Women's Singles tournament.

article:
Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey
=============================

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey is a 2023 American slasher film directed by Rhys Frake-Waterfield and written by Frake-Waterfield and Scott Jeffery. The film is based on the characters created by A.A. Milne and serves as a horror reimagining of the classic children's stories.

Plot
-----

The film takes place in the Hundred Acre Wood, where Winnie-the-Pooh and his friend Piglet have grown up and become violent and feral after being abandoned by their owner Christopher Robin. The two friends begin to hunt and kill anyone who enters their territory, including a group of college students who venture into the woods to explore.

As the bodies pile up, a group of survivors must band together to try and escape the clutches of Pooh and Piglet. Meanwhile, a dark secret from Christopher Robin's past is revealed, which explains why he abandoned his friends in the woods.

The film's plot is a dark and twisted take on the classic Winnie-the-Pooh stories, with plenty of gore and violence. It has been described as a "traumatic" and "unhinged" reimagining of the beloved characters.

Cast
-----

* Craig David Dowsett as Winnie-the-Pooh
* Chris Cordell as Piglet
* Natasha Tosini as Jess
* Amber Doig-Thorne as Maria
* Nikolai Leon as Paul
* Maria Taylor as Alison
* Danielle Ronald as Zoe

Production
------------

### Development

The idea for Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was conceived by director Rhys Frake-Waterfield and writer Scott Jeffery. The two had previously collaborated on several short films and were looking to make a feature-length project together. They decided to take a classic children's story and turn it into a horror film, with Winnie-the-Pooh being their top choice.

The film's script was written in just a few weeks, with the two writers drawing inspiration from classic horror films such as The Texas Chain Saw Massacre and The Hills Have Eyes. They also incorporated elements of the original Winnie-the-Pooh stories, including the characters and settings.

### Filming

Principal photography for Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey took place in October 2022, with a cast and crew of just over 20 people. The film was shot on location in the woods of East Sussex, England, with the crew using a combination of digital cameras and practical effects to bring the film to life.

The shoot was relatively quick, with the entire film being shot in just 10 days. The cast and crew worked long hours to get everything done on time, with some days lasting up to 12 hours.

### Music

The film's score was composed by Andrew Scott Bell, who had previously worked with the director on several short films. The score is a dark and ominous combination of electronic and orchestral elements, perfectly capturing the mood and tone of the film.

The soundtrack also features several songs by various artists, including a haunting rendition of the classic Winnie-the-Pooh theme song.

Release
--------

### Marketing

The marketing campaign for Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was relatively low-key, with the film's trailer being released just a few weeks before its release date. The trailer was a huge hit, with many people expressing their shock and surprise at the film's dark and violent take on the classic characters.

The film's poster was also released, featuring a haunting image of Winnie-the-Pooh and Piglet standing in the woods, with a tagline that read "The woods are waiting".

### Home media

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was released on DVD and Blu-ray in February 2023, with several special features including a making-of documentary and a commentary track with the director and cast.

Reception
----------

### Box office

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was a moderate box office success, grossing over $1 million in its opening weekend. The film went on to gross over $5 million worldwide, making it a profitable venture for the filmmakers.

### Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising its originality and others criticizing its violence and gore. The film holds a 50% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising its ambition and creativity.

### Accolades

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey was nominated for several awards, including a Fangoria Chainsaw Award for Best Limited Release Film. The film also won several awards at horror film festivals around the world, including the Best Feature Film award at the 2023 FrightFest.

Future
--------

### Sequel

A sequel to Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey is currently in development, with the director and cast set to return. The sequel is expected to be released in 2025, with a script currently being written.

### Shared universe and other projects

The filmmakers have expressed interest in expanding the Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey universe, with several spin-off films and TV shows currently in development. A TV series based on the film is also in the works, with a script currently being written.

article:
2022 Russian Mobilization

The 2022 Russian mobilization was a partial mobilization of the Russian Armed Forces announced by Russian President Vladimir Putin on September 21, 2022. The mobilization was a response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine, which had begun in February 2022. The move was seen as a significant escalation of the conflict and had far-reaching consequences for Russia and the international community.

#Background

##Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics

In 2014, pro-Russian separatists declared independence in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions of Ukraine, leading to the establishment of the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and the Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The conflict in eastern Ukraine had been ongoing for eight years, with Russia providing military and economic support to the separatist regions.

##Russia

###Russian losses

The Russian invasion of Ukraine had resulted in significant losses for the Russian military. By September 2022, estimates suggested that between 5,000 to 6,000 Russian soldiers had been killed in action. The losses had put pressure on the Russian government to find ways to replenish its military personnel.

#Prelude

##Volunteer recruitment campaign

In the months leading up to the mobilization, the Russian government had launched a volunteer recruitment campaign to encourage citizens to join the military. The campaign had limited success, with many Russians reluctant to fight in Ukraine.

##Legislative changes

In June 2022, the Russian government had amended the country's military conscription law to allow for the mobilization of citizens up to the age of 65. The changes had been seen as a precursor to a potential mobilization.

##Recruitment of prisoners

In July 2022, the Russian government had begun recruiting prisoners to fight in Ukraine. The move had been widely criticized, with many arguing that it was a desperate attempt to find new recruits.

#Putin's speech

On September 21, 2022, President Putin delivered a televised speech in which he announced the partial mobilization of the Russian Armed Forces. Putin stated that the mobilization was necessary to protect Russian territory and to support the separatist regions in eastern Ukraine.

#Decree

##Official publication and entry into force

Following Putin's speech, a presidential decree was published on the Kremlin's website, outlining the details of the mobilization. The decree came into force immediately.

##Point 7

Point 7 of the decree stated that the mobilization would include the call-up of reservists, as well as the recruitment of new soldiers. The point also stated that citizens who were called up would be given military training before being sent to Ukraine.

#Organization

##Text of decree

The decree outlined the organization of the mobilization, including the creation of a mobilization headquarters and the establishment of mobilization centers across Russia.

##Citizens to be mobilized

The decree stated that citizens who were called up would include reservists, as well as those who had previously served in the military. The decree also stated that citizens who were called up would be given the opportunity to refuse to serve, but that those who did so would face penalties.

#Implementation

##Dates

The mobilization was set to begin on September 22, 2022, with the call-up of reservists and the recruitment of new soldiers. The mobilization was expected to last for several months.

#Reactions

##In Russia

###Markets

The announcement of the mobilization led to a significant decline in the Russian stock market, with the ruble falling to a record low against the US dollar.

###Russian officials and their families

Many Russian officials and their families were seen fleeing Russia in the days following the announcement of the mobilization.

###Within the Russian military

There were reports of low morale within the Russian military, with many soldiers expressing concerns about the mobilization and the prospect of being sent to Ukraine.

###Help for army conscripts

Many Russians took to social media to offer help and support to army conscripts, with some offering food, clothing, and other essentials.

###Exodus of Russians

In the days following the announcement of the mobilization, there was a significant exodus of Russians from the country, with many fleeing to neighboring countries such as Kazakhstan and Georgia.

###Protests

There were reports of protests across Russia, with many Russians expressing opposition to the mobilization and the war in Ukraine.

###Attacks

There were reports of attacks on military recruitment centers across Russia, with some centers being set on fire.

##In Ukraine

The announcement of the mobilization was seen as a significant escalation of the conflict in Ukraine, with many Ukrainians expressing concerns about the potential for increased violence.

##International

The international community condemned the mobilization, with many countries expressing concerns about the potential for increased violence and instability in the region.

#Analysis

##Casualties

The mobilization was expected to lead to a significant increase in casualties on both sides, with many analysts predicting a prolonged and bloody conflict.

article:
Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery is a 2022 mystery film written and directed by Rian Johnson and produced by Johnson and Ram Bergman. It is the sequel to Johnson's 2019 film Knives Out and stars Daniel Craig, Edward Norton, Janelle Monáe, Kathryn Hahn, Leslie Odom Jr., Jessica Henwick, Madelyn Cline, and Dave Bautista. The film follows detective Benoit Blanc as he is invited to a wealthy tech mogul's private island for a murder mystery game, only to find himself embroiled in a real-life murder investigation.

#Plot

The film takes place in 2021, during the COVID-19 pandemic. Benoit Blanc, a renowned private detective, is feeling unfulfilled and restless. He is then invited by Miles Bron, a wealthy and charismatic tech mogul, to his private island in Greece for a murder mystery game. The other guests include Kate Hudson as Birdie Jay, a supermodel; Leslie Odom Jr. as Lionel Toussaint, a scientist; and Kathryn Hahn as Claire Debella, a politician. Upon arrival, the guests are surprised to find that the game is not just a simulation, but a real-life murder investigation, as Miles is found dead.

As the investigation unfolds, Blanc discovers that each guest had a motive for the murder. The film's narrative is layered with twists and turns, keeping the audience guessing until the very end. Through a series of flashbacks and revelations, Blanc uncovers the truth behind Miles' death, exposing the dark secrets and lies that bind the group together.

#Cast

The film boasts an ensemble cast, including:

* Daniel Craig as Benoit Blanc, a renowned private detective
* Edward Norton as Miles Bron, a wealthy tech mogul
* Janelle Monáe as Cassandra "Andi" Brand, Miles' business partner and ex-girlfriend
* Kathryn Hahn as Claire Debella, a politician
* Leslie Odom Jr. as Lionel Toussaint, a scientist
* Jessica Henwick as Peg, Birdie's assistant
* Madelyn Cline as Whiskey, Duke's girlfriend
* Dave Bautista as Duke Cody, a men's rights activist and streamer
* Kate Hudson as Birdie Jay, a supermodel

#Production

##Development

Rian Johnson had always envisioned Knives Out as the first in a series of Benoit Blanc mysteries. After the success of the first film, Johnson began working on the sequel, which would eventually become Glass Onion. Johnson has stated that he was inspired by the works of Agatha Christie, particularly her use of isolated settings and ensemble casts.

##Writing

Johnson wrote the screenplay for Glass Onion over several months, drawing inspiration from his own experiences during the COVID-19 pandemic. He has stated that he wanted to explore the themes of isolation, privilege, and the darker aspects of human nature. The film's script was heavily influenced by Johnson's own feelings of restlessness and discontent during the pandemic.

##Casting

Casting for the film began in March 2021, with Daniel Craig reprising his role as Benoit Blanc. The rest of the cast was announced over the following months, with Edward Norton, Janelle Monáe, and Kathryn Hahn among the first to be cast.

##Filming

Principal photography for Glass Onion began in June 2021, on the Greek island of Spetses. The film was shot on location over several weeks, with additional scenes filmed in the United States. The film's cinematography was handled by Steve Yedlin, who had previously worked with Johnson on Knives Out.

##Music

The film's score was composed by Nathan Johnson, Rian Johnson's cousin. The score features a mix of jazz and classical influences, with a nod to the film's Greek setting.

#Release

##Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in September 2022, with the release of the first trailer. The trailer received widespread attention, with many praising the film's star-studded cast and intriguing plot.

##Theatrical and streaming

Glass Onion was released in theaters on November 23, 2022, for a limited one-week run. The film was then released on Netflix on December 23, 2022. The film's release was met with widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's clever plot and strong performances.

##Home media

Glass Onion was released on DVD and Blu-ray on March 28, 2023. The film's home media release includes several behind-the-scenes featurettes and deleted scenes.

#Reception

##Box office

Glass Onion grossed over $15 million at the domestic box office, with an additional $10 million internationally. While the film's box office performance was modest, it was still considered a success given its limited release.

##Critical response

Glass Onion received widespread critical acclaim, with an approval rating of 92% on Rotten Tomatoes. Many praised the film's clever plot, strong performances, and witty dialogue. The film's themes of privilege and isolation were also widely praised.

##Themes

Glass Onion explores several themes, including privilege, isolation, and the darker aspects of human nature. The film's use of a wealthy tech mogul as the victim serves as a commentary on the excesses of wealth and power.

##Accolades

Glass Onion received several awards and nominations, including a Golden Globe nomination for Best Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy. The film also received several Critics' Choice Awards nominations, including Best Acting Ensemble.

#Sequel

A third Benoit Blanc mystery is currently in development, with Rian Johnson set to write and direct. The film's plot and cast have not been announced, but Johnson has stated that he is excited to continue exploring the character of Benoit Blanc.

article:
Seymour Hersh

Seymour Myron Hersh is an American investigative journalist and author known for his groundbreaking and often provocative reporting on national security, politics, and social issues. With a career spanning over five decades, Hersh has established himself as one of the most respected and feared investigative journalists in the world.

#Early life and education

Seymour Hersh was born on April 8, 1937, in Chicago, Illinois, to a family of Jewish immigrants from Lithuania. He grew up in a middle-class neighborhood in Chicago and developed an interest in journalism at an early age. Hersh attended the University of Chicago, where he studied history and later earned a bachelor's degree in 1958. After college, he worked as a police reporter for the City News Bureau in Chicago before joining the United States Army in 1959. During his time in the Army, Hersh served in the 3rd Armored Division and later as a press officer in the Pentagon.

#Newspaper career

##My Lai massacre

Hersh's investigative reporting career began in 1969, when he was working as a freelance journalist in Vietnam. He was the first to report on the My Lai Massacre, a mass killing of unarmed Vietnamese civilians by American soldiers in 1968. Hersh's reporting on the massacre, which was initially met with skepticism and resistance from the US military and government, eventually led to widespread outrage and calls for accountability. The story earned Hersh a Pulitzer Prize in 1970 and established him as a prominent voice in investigative journalism.

##The New York Times

In 1972, Hersh joined The New York Times as a investigative reporter, where he worked alongside other prominent journalists, including Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein. During his time at the Times, Hersh reported on a wide range of topics, including the CIA's involvement in the overthrow of Salvador Allende in Chile and the US government's secret bombing campaign in Cambodia during the Vietnam War.

#Investigative books: 1980s and 1990s

In the 1980s and 1990s, Hersh turned his attention to writing investigative books. His first book, "The Price of Power: Kissinger in the Nixon White House" (1983), was a critical examination of Henry Kissinger's role in shaping US foreign policy during the Nixon administration. The book was a bestseller and solidified Hersh's reputation as a fearless and dogged investigator.

Hersh went on to write several more books, including "The Target Is Destroyed: What Really Happened to Flight 007 and What America Knew About It" (1986), which explored the downing of Korean Air Lines Flight 007 by a Soviet Su-15 interceptors, and "The Samson Option: Israel's Nuclear Arsenal and American Foreign Policy" (1991), which examined Israel's nuclear program and its implications for US foreign policy.

#Later investigations

##Iraq and Abu Ghraib

In the early 2000s, Hersh turned his attention to the US-led invasion of Iraq and the subsequent occupation. He reported extensively on the treatment of Iraqi prisoners by US soldiers, including the Abu Ghraib prison abuse scandal. Hersh's reporting on the scandal, which included allegations of torture and mistreatment of prisoners, sparked widespread outrage and calls for accountability.

##Iran

In 2012, Hersh reported on the US and Israeli governments' secret efforts to undermine Iran's nuclear program. His reporting included allegations of covert operations, including cyber attacks and sabotage, aimed at disrupting Iran's nuclear facilities.

##Syria and chemical attacks

In 2013, Hersh reported on the Syrian government's alleged use of chemical weapons against civilians. His reporting, which included claims that the Obama administration had manipulated intelligence to justify a military strike against Syria, was widely criticized by the US government and other media outlets.

##Killing of Osama bin Laden

In 2015, Hersh reported on the US government's official account of the killing of Osama bin Laden. His reporting, which included claims that the US government had lied about the circumstances of bin Laden's death, sparked a heated debate over the accuracy of the official narrative.

##Nord Stream pipeline and Ukraine

In 2022, Hersh reported on the US government's alleged involvement in the sabotage of the Nord Stream pipeline, a major natural gas pipeline that runs from Russia to Germany. His reporting, which included claims that the US government had worked with Ukrainian intelligence to carry out the attack, was widely criticized by the US government and other media outlets.

#Other statements

##Speeches

Hersh has given numerous speeches and lectures on topics related to national security, politics, and journalism. In 2013, he delivered a speech at the University of Chicago, in which he criticized the US government's handling of the Syrian civil war and the use of drones in counterterrorism operations.

##Murder of Seth Rich

In 2017, Hersh made headlines when he claimed that he had evidence that DNC staffer Seth Rich had been in contact with WikiLeaks before his murder. Hersh's claims, which were widely reported in the media, were later disputed by the Washington D.C. police department and other investigators.

##Pat Nixon abuse

In 2016, Hersh reported on allegations that Pat Nixon, the wife of former President Richard Nixon, had been physically abused by her husband. Hersh's reporting, which included claims that Nixon had a history of domestic violence, was widely criticized by the Nixon family and other historians.

#Use of anonymous sources

Hersh has long been known for his use of anonymous sources in his reporting. While some have criticized him for relying too heavily on unnamed sources, Hersh has defended his methods, arguing that they are necessary to get to the truth in cases where government officials and other powerful individuals are reluctant to speak on the record.

#Personal life

Hersh is married to Elizabeth Sarah Klein, a lawyer and former employee of the US State Department. The couple has two children and lives in Washington, D.C.

#Awards and honors

Hersh has won numerous awards for his reporting, including the Pulitzer Prize, the National Book Award, and the Polk Award. He has also been named a fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and a member of the Council on Foreign Relations.

#Publications

* "The Target Is Destroyed: What Really Happened to Flight 007 and What America Knew About It" (1986)
* "The Samson Option: Israel's Nuclear Arsenal and American Foreign Policy" (1991)
* "The Dark Side of Camelot" (1997)
* "Against All Enemies: Gulf War Syndrome, the War Between America's Ailing Veterans and Their Government" (1998)
* "Chain of Command: The Road from 9/11 to Abu Ghraib" (2004)
* "The Samson Option: Israel, America and the Bomb" (2013)

##Articles

* "My Lai 4: A Report on the Massacre and Its Aftermath" (1970)

2023 SAFF Championship

The 2023 SAFF Championship is the 14th edition of the SAFF Championship, the biennial international men's football championship of South Asia organized by the South Asian Football Federation (SAFF). The tournament is scheduled to take place in India from June 21 to July 4, 2023.

# Host selection

India was announced as the host of the 2023 SAFF Championship by the SAFF on March 7, 2022. This will be the second time India has hosted the tournament, after the 1999 SAFF Gold Cup.

# Participating nations

Seven teams from the South Asian region will participate in the tournament. The teams are:

*  Bangladesh
*  Bhutan
*  India
*  Maldives
*  Nepal
*  Pakistan
*  Sri Lanka

## Squads

Each team will be allowed to have a squad of 23 players, with three goalkeepers. The squads will be announced by the teams before the start of the tournament.

# Venue

The tournament will be held at the Sree Kanteerava Stadium in Bangalore, India. The stadium has a seating capacity of 25,810 and has hosted several international football matches in the past.

# Draw

The draw for the tournament was held on May 17, 2023, in New Delhi, India. The teams were divided into two groups of three and four teams each. The top two teams from each group will qualify for the semi-finals.

## Draw result

*  Nepal
*  Pakistan

*  Sri Lanka

# Officiating

The tournament will be officiated by referees and assistant referees from the South Asian region. The referees will be appointed by the SAFF Referees Committee.

# Group stage

The group stage will be played from June 21 to June 28, 2023. Each team will play the other teams in their group once. The top two teams from each group will qualify for the semi-finals.

India won the 2023 SAFF Championship, defeating Bangladesh 2-1 in the final. This is India's eighth SAFF Championship title.
