Lakota Religion

The Lakota people, also known as the Teton Sioux, are a Native American tribe that traditionally resided in the Great Plains region of North America. Their spiritual tradition, known as Lakota religion, is a complex and multifaceted system that encompasses various beliefs, practices, and rituals. This article provides an overview of the Lakota religion, exploring its definition and classification, core beliefs, practices, history, demographics, and reception and influence.

# Definition and classification

Lakota religion is a form of indigenous spirituality that is rooted in the cultural and historical context of the Lakota people. It is often classified as a form of animism, as it posits that all living beings, including animals, plants, and natural elements, possess a spiritual essence or consciousness. The Lakota tradition also incorporates elements of shamanism, as it recognizes the existence of spiritual practitioners who possess special powers and knowledge.

# Beliefs

## Wakʽą and Wakʽą Tʽąką

Central to Lakota spirituality is the concept of Wakʽą, a term that refers to the mysterious, sacred, and powerful forces that permeate the universe. Wakʽą is often translated as "sacred" or "mysterious," but its meaning is more nuanced and complex. It encompasses the idea that all things are interconnected and that the natural world is imbued with spiritual energy. Wakʽą Tʽąką, or the "Wakʽą beings," are a group of powerful spirits that are believed to inhabit the natural world and possess special powers.

## Wakʽąpi

Wakʽąpi are a type of spirit being that is believed to inhabit the natural world. They are often depicted as powerful, shape-shifting beings that possess special powers and knowledge. Wakʽąpi are associated with various aspects of nature, such as the wind, thunder, and lightning.

## Cosmogony

The Lakota people have a rich and complex cosmogony that explains the origins of the universe and the natural world. According to Lakota mythology, the universe was created by the Wakʽą Tʽąką, who brought forth the sun, moon, stars, and all living things.

## Spirit and afterlife

The Lakota people believe in a complex and multifaceted concept of spirit and afterlife. They believe that all living beings possess a spiritual essence, known as the "shadow" or "soul," which continues to exist after death. The afterlife is believed to be a continuation of life on earth, with the deceased person existing in a spiritual realm.

## Animism and kinship

The Lakota people believe in a form of animism that posits that all living beings are interconnected and that the natural world is imbued with spiritual energy. They believe in a complex system of kinship, where all living beings are related and interconnected. This includes not only humans but also animals, plants, and natural elements.

### Šicųpi and wašicu

Šicųpi and wašicu are two terms that are used to describe the interconnectedness of all living beings. Šicųpi refers to the spiritual essence that connects all living beings, while wašicu refers to the physical world and the natural environment.

## Cosmology and the sacred hoop

The Lakota people have a rich and complex cosmology that explains the structure and organization of the universe. They believe in a concept known as the "sacred hoop," which refers to the interconnectedness of all living beings and the natural world. The sacred hoop is often depicted as a circle, which represents the unity and interconnectedness of all things.

## Morality and gender roles

The Lakota people have a complex system of morality and gender roles that are rooted in their spiritual tradition. They believe in a concept known as "mitakuye oyasin," or "we are all related," which emphasizes the interconnectedness of all living beings. They also believe in a complex system of gender roles, where men and women possess different spiritual powers and responsibilities.

# Practices

## Prayer and offerings

The Lakota people have a rich and complex tradition of prayer and offerings. They believe in making offerings to the Wakʽą Tʽąką and other spirits, which can take the form of food, tobacco, or other gifts. They also believe in praying to the spirits, which can take the form of songs, chants, or spoken words.

### Suffering and sacrifice

The Lakota people believe in the importance of suffering and sacrifice in their spiritual tradition. They believe that suffering can be a form of spiritual purification, and that sacrifice can be a way of showing respect and gratitude to the spirits.

## The sacred pipe

The sacred pipe is a central element of Lakota spirituality. It is believed to be a sacred instrument that connects the physical and spiritual worlds. The pipe is often used in ceremonies and rituals, where it is used to offer prayers and make offerings to the spirits.

## Sweat lodge

The sweat lodge is a type of ceremonial structure that is used in Lakota spirituality. It is believed to be a sacred space where individuals can purify their bodies and spirits through sweating and prayer.

## Vision quest

The vision quest is a type of spiritual practice that is used in Lakota spirituality. It involves an individual isolating themselves in a wilderness area, where they fast and pray in order to receive spiritual visions and guidance.

## Sun dance

The sun dance is a type of ceremony that is used in Lakota spirituality. It involves a group of individuals dancing and singing in order to honor the sun and the spirits. The sun dance is often used to promote spiritual growth and renewal.

## Further rites

The Lakota people have a number of further rites and ceremonies that are used in their spiritual tradition. These can include the "giveaway" ceremony, where individuals give away possessions and food to others, and the "naming" ceremony, where individuals are given spiritual names.

## Healing and cursing

The Lakota people believe in a complex system of healing and cursing. They believe that spiritual practitioners can use their powers to heal or harm others, and that the spirits can be used to bring about positive or negative change.

## Holy men

The Lakota people have a number of spiritual practitioners who are known as "holy men." These individuals are believed to possess special powers and knowledge, and are often sought out for guidance and healing.

### Yuwípi and yuwípi wičháša

Yuwípi and yuwípi wičháša are two terms that are used to describe the spiritual practitioners of the Lakota people. Yuwípi refers to a spiritual practitioner who has received spiritual visions and guidance, while yuwípi wičháša refers to a spiritual practitioner who has received spiritual powers and knowledge.

The Lakota people have a number of other spiritual specialists, including the "cănągapi," or "scarer," who is responsible for scaring away evil spirits, and the "wakaŋ," or "shaman," who is responsible for communicating with the spirits.

# History

## Prehistory

The Lakota people have a long and complex history that dates back thousands of years. They are believed to have originated in the Great Plains region of North America, where they developed a rich and complex spiritual tradition.

The Lakota people had significant encounters with Christianity and colonialism in the 19th and 20th centuries. Many Lakota individuals converted to Christianity, while others resisted the imposition of foreign spiritual traditions.

In the 20th century, the Lakota people experienced a spiritual revival, where they sought to revitalize their traditional spiritual practices. This movement was led by a number of spiritual leaders, who sought to promote the use of traditional spiritual practices and to resist the influence of foreign spiritual traditions.

SDG Publishers Compact

The SDG Publishers Compact is a collaborative initiative between academic publishers and the United Nations (UN) to accelerate progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The compact aims to leverage the expertise and resources of the publishing industry to support the achievement of the SDGs, which were adopted by the UN General Assembly in 2015. This article provides an overview of the SDG Publishers Compact, including its formation, commitments, signatories, fellows, and actions.

# Formation

The SDG Publishers Compact was launched in October 2019, during the Frankfurt Book Fair, in collaboration with the UN's Department of Global Communications. The compact was established in response to the growing recognition of the critical role that academic publishing can play in supporting the SDGs. The initiative was driven by the understanding that academic publishers have a unique opportunity to contribute to the achievement of the SDGs, through the dissemination of high-quality research and knowledge.

# Commitments

The SDG Publishers Compact is built around a set of commitments that signatory publishers agree to uphold. These commitments focus on three key areas: discursive effects, normative effects, and institutional effects. The commitments aim to promote a culture of sustainability, equity, and inclusion within the publishing industry, and to support the achievement of the SDGs through the dissemination of relevant research and knowledge.

# Signatories

The SDG Publishers Compact has attracted a diverse range of signatory publishers, including major academic publishers, university presses, and smaller independent publishers. Signatories include publishers from around the world, representing different regions, languages, and subject areas. The compact is open to all publishers that share its vision and values, and that are committed to supporting the achievement of the SDGs.

# Fellows

In addition to signatory publishers, the SDG Publishers Compact also has a program for fellows. Fellows are individuals who are committed to supporting the achievement of the SDGs, and who have expertise in relevant areas. Fellows can come from a range of backgrounds, including academia, publishing, and civil society. The fellow program provides an opportunity for individuals to contribute to the work of the compact, and to support the achievement of the SDGs.

# Actions

The SDG Publishers Compact has a range of actions that aim to support the achievement of the SDGs. These actions focus on three key areas: discursive effects, normative effects, and institutional effects.

## Discursive effects

The SDG Publishers Compact aims to promote a culture of sustainability, equity, and inclusion within the publishing industry. This includes promoting diversity and inclusivity in publishing, and supporting the development of new business models that prioritize sustainability and social impact.

## Normative effects

This includes promoting the adoption of sustainable practices, such as carbon-neutral publishing, and supporting the development of new standards and guidelines for sustainable publishing.

## Institutional effects

This includes supporting the development of new business models, and promoting the adoption of sustainable practices throughout the publishing industry.

This includes promoting the use of renewable energy, and supporting the development of new technologies that reduce the carbon footprint of publishing.

### Publications

Mug Shot of Donald Trump

The mug shot of Donald Trump is a photograph of the 45th President of the United States, taken after his arrest on August 24, 2023, in Fulton County, Georgia. The image, which has been widely disseminated and scrutinized by the media and the public, has become a significant and symbolic representation of Trump's ongoing legal troubles.

Background

The mug shot was taken by the Fulton County Sheriff's Office after Trump surrendered to authorities in connection with a 2020 election interference case. Trump, who had been indicted by a grand jury in July 2023, had been ordered to turn himself in by a judge. The photograph was released to the public shortly after Trump's booking, in accordance with standard procedure for arrested individuals in Fulton County.

The image depicts Trump with a stern expression, looking directly at the camera. He is wearing a suit and tie, and his hair is styled in his signature manner. The background of the photograph is a standard grey, and a placard with Trump's name and booking number is visible.

Usage

The mug shot of Donald Trump has been widely used in various contexts, including fundraising and news coverage.

### Fundraising

The mug shot has been used by both Trump's supporters and opponents in fundraising efforts. Trump's campaign has sold merchandise featuring the image, including t-shirts and mugs, with the slogan "Free Trump" emblazoned on them. The campaign has claimed that the sales have been brisk, with many supporters eager to show their support for the embattled president.

On the other hand, Trump's opponents have also used the image in fundraising efforts, often with a more mocking or satirical tone. For example, the Democratic National Committee has sold t-shirts featuring the mug shot with the slogan "Lock Him Up" printed on them.

### News coverage

The mug shot has been extensively covered in the news media, with many outlets analyzing the image and its significance. Some commentators have noted that the photograph humanizes Trump, showing him in a vulnerable and humbling position. Others have argued that the image is a symbol of Trump's downfall, representing the culmination of years of controversy and scandal.

The media has also scrutinized the details of the photograph, including Trump's expression and attire. Some have noted that Trump's hair appears to be styled in a manner that is similar to his usual public appearances, leading to speculation about whether he had access to a stylist before the photograph was taken.

Reactions

The mug shot of Donald Trump has elicited a wide range of reactions from the public and from politicians. Some have expressed sympathy for Trump, arguing that the image is a private moment that should not have been released to the public. Others have mocked Trump, using the image to ridicule his appearance and his situation.

Trump himself has responded to the image, claiming that it is a "fake" and that he was "treated unfairly" by the authorities. He has also used the image to rally his supporters, claiming that the photograph is evidence of the "deep state" conspiracy against him.

# Biography

## Personal life and ancestry

Heinrich XIII, Prinz Reuss was born on December 4, 1951, in Gera, East Germany. He is a member of the House of Reuss, a noble family that ruled over the Principality of Reuss-Gera from 1778 to 1918. article:
The Northman
=============

The Northman is a 2022 epic historical revenge thriller film directed by Robert Eggers and written by Eggers and Sjón. The film is based on the legend of Amleth, a figure from Norse mythology, and stars Alexander Skarsgård, Nicole Kidman, Claes Bang, Anya Taylor-Joy, and Ethan Hawke.

Plot
-----

The Northman is set in 10th-century Iceland and follows the story of Amleth (Alexander Skarsgård), a Viking prince who seeks to avenge his father's murder. As a child, Amleth witnesses the brutal killing of his father, King Aurvandill (Ethan Hawke), by his uncle Fjölnir (Claes Bang). Amleth's mother, Queen Gudrun (Nicole Kidman), is taken captive by Fjölnir, who claims the throne for himself.

Years later, Amleth has grown into a powerful and ruthless warrior, driven by his desire for revenge against his uncle. He sets out on a perilous journey to reclaim his rightful place as king and to avenge his father's death. Along the way, he encounters a range of characters, including a mysterious and alluring slave girl named Olga (Anya Taylor-Joy), who becomes his ally and potential love interest.

As Amleth navigates the treacherous world of Viking politics and mythology, he must confront his own demons and the harsh realities of his quest for revenge. The film builds towards a bloody and intense showdown between Amleth and Fjölnir, which will determine the fate of the kingdom and the future of the Viking people.

Cast
-----

* Alexander Skarsgård as Amleth
* Nicole Kidman as Queen Gudrun
* Claes Bang as Fjölnir
* Anya Taylor-Joy as Olga
* Ethan Hawke as King Aurvandill
* Willem Dafoe as Heimir the Fool
* Björk as The Seeress
* Ralph Ineson as Captain Volodymyr
* Kate Dickie as Halldora the Pict
* Ian Gerard Whyte as Thór
* Hafþór Júlíus Björnsson as Thorfinnr

Production
------------

### Development

The Northman was first announced in 2019, with Robert Eggers set to direct and write the screenplay. Eggers had previously directed The Witch (2015) and The Lighthouse (2019), and had established a reputation for his meticulous attention to detail and his ability to create immersive and atmospheric worlds.

Eggers was drawn to the legend of Amleth, which he saw as a powerful and timeless story of revenge and redemption. He worked closely with the Icelandic writer Sjón to develop the screenplay, which was influenced by Norse mythology and the Viking sagas.

### Filming

Principal photography on The Northman began in March 2021, with filming taking place in Ireland and Iceland. The film was shot on location, using a combination of natural landscapes and specially constructed sets.

The film's cinematographer, Jarin Blaschke, used a range of techniques to create a distinctive and atmospheric visual style. The film was shot in black and white, with a focus on natural light and a muted color palette.

### Post-production

Post-production on The Northman took place in the summer and autumn of 2021. The film's editor, Louise Ford, worked closely with Eggers to create a tight and efficient narrative, which balanced action, drama, and suspense.

The film's visual effects were created by the Icelandic company RVX, which used a combination of practical and CGI techniques to bring the Viking world to life.

### Music

The Northman's score was composed by Robin Carolan and Sebastian Gainsborough, who drew on a range of influences, including Norse folk music and avant-garde electronic music. The score was performed by a range of musicians, including the Icelandic group Sigur Rós.

Marketing
----------

### Tie-in media

In the run-up to the film's release, a range of tie-in media was published, including a novelization of the screenplay and a behind-the-scenes book.

The novelization, which was written by Robert Eggers and Sjón, provided a detailed and immersive account of the film's story and world. The behind-the-scenes book, which was written by the film's production designer, Craig Lathrop, offered a unique insight into the film's making, with a range of photographs and interviews.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

The Northman was released in the United States on April 22, 2022, with a limited release in select theaters. The film expanded to a wider release on April 29, 2022, with a total of 3,865 theaters.

The film received a range of premieres and screenings, including a gala premiere at the 2022 Sundance Film Festival.

### Home media

The Northman was released on digital platforms on June 3, 2022, with a Blu-ray and DVD release following on June 17, 2022.

Reception
----------

### Box office

The Northman was a moderate commercial success, grossing over $69 million at the global box office. The film performed well in the United States, where it grossed over $34 million, but struggled in some international markets.

### Home media performance

The Northman performed well on home media, with a strong digital release and a successful Blu-ray and DVD release. The film was a top seller on Amazon and iTunes, and received a range of positive reviews from home media critics.

### Critical response

The Northman received widespread critical acclaim, with an approval rating of 89% on Rotten Tomatoes. The film was praised for its atmospheric and immersive world, its strong performances, and its intense and suspenseful action sequences.

Many critics praised the film's attention to detail and its commitment to historical accuracy, with some noting that the film was a major achievement in terms of production design and cinematography.

### Accolades

article:
Sun Belt

The Sun Belt is a region in the southern United States, characterized by a warm climate, rapid population growth, and a strong economy. The term was first coined in the 1960s to describe the region's growing popularity as a destination for tourists and retirees. Today, the Sun Belt is one of the most populous and economically vibrant regions in the country.

# Migration

The Sun Belt has been a major destination for migrants from other parts of the United States, particularly from the Northeast and Midwest. The region's warm climate, affordable housing, and strong economy have made it an attractive destination for people looking to escape cold winters and high costs of living. Between 1950 and 2000, the Sun Belt gained over 30 million new residents, with many of them settling in cities such as Miami, Phoenix, and Houston.

## Snowbirds

One of the most notable migration patterns in the Sun Belt is the phenomenon of "snowbirds," or seasonal migrants who escape cold winters in the North to spend time in the warmer climates of the South. Many snowbirds are retirees or wealthy individuals who maintain homes in both the North and South, and spend the winter months in the Sun Belt. This migration pattern has contributed significantly to the growth and development of cities such as Palm Springs, California, and Naples, Florida.

## Domestic Migration

In addition to snowbirds, the Sun Belt has also attracted large numbers of domestic migrants from other parts of the country. Many of these migrants are young professionals or families who are drawn to the region's strong economy, good schools, and high quality of life. Cities such as Austin, Texas, and Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina, have become major hubs for technology and biotechnology industries, attracting thousands of new residents each year.

# Definition

The Sun Belt is generally defined as the region of the United States that lies south of the 36th parallel, including the states of Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi, New Mexico, North Carolina, Oklahoma, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Texas. However, some definitions of the Sun Belt also include parts of California, Kentucky, and Virginia.

## Climate

The Sun Belt is characterized by a warm and humid climate, with mild winters and hot summers. The region's climate is influenced by its proximity to the Gulf of Mexico and the Atlantic Ocean, which moderate temperatures and provide moisture. The Sun Belt is also home to a variety of ecosystems, including deserts, swamps, and forests.

## Economy

The Sun Belt has a strong and diverse economy, with major industries including tourism, agriculture, technology, and manufacturing. The region is home to many major cities, including Miami, Phoenix, and Houston, which are hubs for international trade and commerce. The Sun Belt is also a major center for the military and defense industries, with many major bases and contractors located in the region.

# Projections

The Sun Belt is expected to continue growing and developing in the coming years, with many projections indicating that the region will become an even more important part of the US economy. According to the US Census Bureau, the Sun Belt is expected to gain over 10 million new residents between 2020 and 2030, with many of these new residents settling in cities such as Austin, Texas, and Orlando, Florida.

## Population Growth

The Sun Belt is expected to experience rapid population growth in the coming years, with many cities in the region projected to double or triple in size. This growth will be driven by a combination of natural increase (the difference between births and deaths) and migration, as more people move to the region to take advantage of its warm climate and strong economy.

## Economic Growth

The Sun Belt is also expected to experience rapid economic growth, with many major industries projected to expand in the coming years. The region's strong economy and high quality of life make it an attractive destination for businesses and investors, and many cities in the Sun Belt are actively courting new companies and developments.

# Politics

The Sun Belt is a region of significant political importance, with many of its states playing key roles in national elections. The region is home to a diverse range of voters, including conservatives, liberals, and moderates, and its politics are often shaped by issues such as immigration, healthcare, and education.

## Republican Stronghold

The Sun Belt has historically been a stronghold for the Republican Party, with many of its states voting consistently for Republican candidates. However, in recent years, the region has become more competitive, with many Democrats winning elections in states such as Florida and North Carolina.

## Democratic Gains

The Sun Belt has also seen significant gains for the Democratic Party in recent years, with many Democrats winning elections in cities such as Miami and Phoenix. The region's growing Hispanic population has been a key factor in these gains, as many Hispanic voters have become more active in politics and have begun to identify as Democrats.

# Environment

The Sun Belt is a region of significant environmental importance, with many of its ecosystems and natural resources under threat from human activity. The region is home to a diverse range of wildlife, including alligators, panthers, and sea turtles, and its natural beauty makes it a popular destination for tourists and outdoor enthusiasts.

## Conservation Efforts

Many organizations and governments are working to protect the Sun Belt's environment, with efforts including conservation of natural habitats, protection of wildlife, and promotion of sustainable development. The region is also home to many national parks and protected areas, including the Everglades and the Grand Canyon.

## Climate Change

The Sun Belt is also vulnerable to the impacts of climate change, with rising temperatures and sea levels posing significant threats to its ecosystems and human populations. Many cities in the region are working to reduce their carbon emissions and promote sustainable development, but more needs to be done to address the scale and urgency of the challenge.

# Major Cities

The Sun Belt is home to many major cities, each with its own unique character and attractions. Some of the region's most notable cities include:

## Miami, Florida

Miami is a major hub for international trade and commerce, and is known for its vibrant cultural scene and beautiful beaches.

## Phoenix, Arizona

Phoenix is the capital of Arizona and is known for its hot desert climate and vibrant downtown area.

## Houston, Texas

Houston is a major center for the energy industry and is known for its diverse cultural scene and world-class museums.

## Austin, Texas

Austin is the capital of Texas and is known for its vibrant music scene and outdoor recreation opportunities.

## Orlando, Florida

Orlando is a major tourist destination and is known for its theme parks and attractions, including Walt Disney World and Universal Studios.

* Southern United States
* Southwest United States
* Gulf Coast of the United States

# References

None

# Further Reading

* Robert M. Adelman and Stewart E. Tolnay, Occupational Segregation and the Earnings Attainment of Women in the United States (1997)

65th Annual Grammy Awards

The 65th Annual Grammy Awards were held on February 5, 2023, at the Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles. The ceremony recognized the best recordings, compositions, and artists of the eligibility year, which ran from October 1, 2021, to September 30, 2022. The awards were presented in 91 categories, with the winners selected from over 20,000 entries.

#Background

The 65th Annual Grammy Awards marked a significant milestone in the music industry, celebrating the best of the past year's recordings and artistic achievements. The ceremony was broadcast live on CBS and streamed on various platforms, including Paramount+.

##Category changes

The Recording Academy made several changes to the award categories for the 65th Annual Grammy Awards. The categories for Best Urban Contemporary Album and Best Rap/Sung Performance were discontinued, while the categories for Best Global Music Album and Best Música Urbana Album were introduced. The category for Best New Artist was also revised to include a more comprehensive definition of new artists.

##Album eligibility

The eligibility criteria for albums were also revised for the 65th Annual Grammy Awards. Albums released between October 1, 2021, and September 30, 2022, were eligible for consideration. The albums had to be released publicly and be available for purchase or streaming.

London, Ontario, a city in southwestern Ontario, Canada, has a complex and multifaceted history of organized crime. This article provides an overview of the history of organized crime in London, highlighting key events, groups, and crime syndicates.

# Overview

Organized crime in London, Ontario, encompasses a broad range of activities, including bank robbery, extortion, drug trafficking, and gang violence. The city's strategic location, situated at the intersection of major highways and rail lines, has made it an attractive hub for organized crime groups. London's diverse population and economy have also contributed to the growth of organized crime, as groups have sought to exploit vulnerabilities and capitalize on opportunities.

London's early history of organized crime dates back to the late 19th century, when the city was a major hub for bootlegging and bank robbery. During this period, notorious outlaws such as Jesse James and Butch Cassidy frequented the city, using it as a hideout and staging ground for their crimes.

article:
2022 Northern Ireland Assembly election

The 2022 Northern Ireland Assembly election was held on Thursday, 5 May 2022, to elect 90 members to the Northern Ireland Assembly. It was the seventh election to the Assembly since its establishment in 1998.

# Background

## Electoral events

The election was the first to be held since the 2019 United Kingdom general election, in which the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) and Sinn Féin had both lost seats in Northern Ireland. The election was also the first to be held since the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a significant impact on the region.

## Leadership changes

In the period leading up to the election, there were significant leadership changes within the main parties. In April 2021, Edwin Poots was elected as the new leader of the DUP, succeeding Arlene Foster. However, Poots' leadership was short-lived, and he was replaced by Jeffrey Donaldson in June 2021. In November 2021, Mary Lou McDonald announced that she would be stepping down as the president of Sinn Féin, and would be succeeded by Michelle O'Neill.

## Northern Ireland Protocol

The Northern Ireland Protocol, which was part of the Brexit withdrawal agreement, was a major issue in the election campaign. The protocol had created new trade barriers between Northern Ireland and the rest of the United Kingdom, which had led to tensions within the DUP and with the British government.

## Calls for early election

In the months leading up to the election, there were repeated calls for an early election to be held. The DUP had threatened to collapse the Assembly unless the British government took action to address their concerns about the protocol. However, the election was ultimately called by the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland, Brandon Lewis, after the DUP withdrew their support for the Assembly.

# Candidates

A total of 239 candidates stood in the election, representing 16 different parties. The DUP and Sinn Féin both ran candidates in all 18 constituencies, while the Ulster Unionist Party (UUP) and the Social Democratic and Labour Party (SDLP) both ran candidates in 17 constituencies.

# Members not seeking re-election

A total of 14 members of the Assembly did not seek re-election. These included several high-profile politicians, including the former DUP leader Arlene Foster and the former UUP leader Robin Swann.

# Campaign

The election campaign was dominated by the issue of the Northern Ireland Protocol, with the DUP and other unionist parties calling for its abolition. Sinn Féin and other nationalist parties, on the other hand, argued that the protocol was essential for protecting the region's economy and preventing a hard border on the island of Ireland.

# Opinion polls

Opinion polls in the run-up to the election suggested that Sinn Féin was on course to become the largest party in the Assembly, with the DUP likely to lose seats. The polls also suggested that the Alliance Party, a cross-community party that had been gaining support in recent years, was likely to make significant gains.

# Results

## Distribution of seats by constituency

The results of the election were as follows:

| Constituency | Party |
| Belfast East | DUP |
| Belfast North | DUP |
| Belfast South | DUP |
| Belfast West | Sinn Féin |

| East Londonderry | DUP |

| Lagan Valley | DUP |
| Mid Ulster | Sinn Féin |

| North Antrim | DUP |
| North Down | Alliance |
| South Antrim | UUP |
| South Down | SDLP |
| Strangford | DUP |
| West Tyrone | Sinn Féin |

## Share of first-preference votes

The share of first-preference votes was as follows:

| Party | Share |
| Sinn Féin | 29.0% |
| DUP | 21.3% |
| Alliance | 13.5% |
| UUP | 11.4% |
| SDLP | 9.1% |
| Green Party | 1.5% |
| People Before Profit | 1.2% |
| TUV | 1.0% |
| Others | 2.0% |

## Incumbents defeated

A total of 14 incumbent members of the Assembly lost their seats in the election. These included several high-profile politicians, including the DUP's Emma Little Pengelly and the UUP's Roy Beggs.

# Aftermath

The election resulted in Sinn Féin becoming the largest party in the Assembly for the first time. The party's leader, Michelle O'Neill, said that she was "proud and humbled" by the result, and called for the formation of a new executive as soon as possible. The DUP's leader, Jeffrey Donaldson, said that his party would not enter into a new executive unless the British government took action to address their concerns about the Northern Ireland Protocol.

2022 Pacific Hurricane Season

The 2022 Pacific hurricane season was a period of intense tropical cyclone activity that officially began on May 15, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean, and on June 1, 2022, in the Central Pacific Ocean. It ended on November 30, 2022, in both basins. The season was marked by a significant increase in activity compared to the previous year, with a total of 19 named storms, 10 hurricanes, and 4 major hurricanes.

# Seasonal forecasts

Before the season began, several forecasting agencies released their predictions for the number of tropical cyclones that would form during the season. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) predicted a 60% chance of an above-normal season, with 15-20 named storms, 7-10 hurricanes, and 2-4 major hurricanes. The Climate Prediction Center (CPC) also predicted an above-normal season, with 16-21 named storms, 8-11 hurricanes, and 3-5 major hurricanes.

# Seasonal summary

The 2022 Pacific hurricane season was one of the most active on record, with a total of 19 named storms, 10 hurricanes, and 4 major hurricanes. The season began early, with the first named storm, Agatha, forming on May 28, 2022. The season saw several notable storms, including Hurricane Bonnie, which became the first major hurricane of the season, and Hurricane Roslyn, which made landfall in Mexico as a Category 4 hurricane.

## Systems

### Hurricane Agatha

Hurricane Agatha was the first named storm of the season, forming on May 28, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on May 30, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 2 hurricane on June 1, 2022. Agatha made landfall in Mexico on June 1, 2022, causing significant damage and flooding.

### Hurricane Blas

Hurricane Blas was the second named storm of the season, forming on June 14, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on June 16, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 1 hurricane on June 18, 2022. Blas dissipated on June 20, 2022, without making landfall.

### Tropical Storm Celia

Tropical Storm Celia was the third named storm of the season, forming on June 17, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a tropical storm on June 18, 2022, and reached its peak intensity on June 20, 2022. Celia dissipated on June 22, 2022, without making landfall.

### Hurricane Bonnie

Hurricane Bonnie was the fourth named storm of the season, forming on July 2, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on July 4, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 3 hurricane on July 6, 2022. Bonnie made landfall in Mexico on July 7, 2022, causing significant damage and flooding.

### Hurricane Darby

Hurricane Darby was the fifth named storm of the season, forming on July 9, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on July 11, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 1 hurricane on July 13, 2022. Darby dissipated on July 15, 2022, without making landfall.

### Hurricane Estelle

Hurricane Estelle was the sixth named storm of the season, forming on July 14, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on July 16, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 1 hurricane on July 18, 2022. Estelle dissipated on July 20, 2022, without making landfall.

### Hurricane Frank

Hurricane Frank was the seventh named storm of the season, forming on July 23, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on July 25, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 1 hurricane on July 27, 2022. Frank dissipated on July 29, 2022, without making landfall.

### Tropical Storm Georgette

Tropical Storm Georgette was the eighth named storm of the season, forming on July 25, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a tropical storm on July 26, 2022, and reached its peak intensity on July 28, 2022. Georgette dissipated on July 30, 2022, without making landfall.

### Hurricane Howard

Hurricane Howard was the ninth named storm of the season, forming on August 3, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on August 5, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 1 hurricane on August 7, 2022. Howard dissipated on August 9, 2022, without making landfall.

### Tropical Storm Ivette

Tropical Storm Ivette was the tenth named storm of the season, forming on August 5, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a tropical storm on August 6, 2022, and reached its peak intensity on August 8, 2022. Ivette dissipated on August 10, 2022, without making landfall.

### Tropical Storm Javier

Tropical Storm Javier was the eleventh named storm of the season, forming on August 7, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a tropical storm on August 8, 2022, and reached its peak intensity on August 10, 2022. Javier dissipated on August 12, 2022, without making landfall.

### Hurricane Kay

Hurricane Kay was the twelfth named storm of the season, forming on August 28, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a hurricane on August 30, 2022, and reached its peak intensity as a Category 2 hurricane on September 1, 2022. Kay made landfall in Mexico on September 1, 2022, causing significant damage and flooding.

### Tropical Storm Lester

Tropical Storm Lester was the thirteenth named storm of the season, forming on September 24, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a tropical storm on September 25, 2022, and reached its peak intensity on September 27, 2022. Lester dissipated on September 29, 2022, without making landfall.

### Tropical Storm Madeline

Tropical Storm Madeline was the fourteenth named storm of the season, forming on September 27, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a tropical storm on September 28, 2022, and reached its peak intensity on September 30, 2022. Madeline dissipated on October 2, 2022, without making landfall.

### Tropical Storm Newton

Tropical Storm Newton was the fifteenth named storm of the season, forming on October 3, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. The storm intensified into a tropical storm on October 4, 2022, and reached its peak intensity on October 6, 2022. Newton dissipated on October 8, 2022, without making landfall.

### Hurricane Orlene

Hurricane Orlene was the sixteenth named storm of the season, forming on October 1, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. ### Tropical Storm Paine

Tropical Storm Paine was the seventeenth named storm of the season, forming on October 2, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. Tropical Storm Julia was the eighteenth named storm of the season, forming on October 8, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. Hurricane Roslyn was the nineteenth and final named storm of the season, forming on October 20, 2022, in the Eastern Pacific Ocean. Roslyn made landfall in Mexico on October 24, 2022, causing significant damage and flooding.

The names used for the 2022 Pacific hurricane season were selected by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) from a list of names that are recycled every six years. # Season effects

The 2022 Pacific hurricane season had significant effects on the countries in the region. article:
Laal Singh Chaddha

Laal Singh Chaddha is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language comedy-drama film directed by Advait Chandan and written by Atul Kulkarni. The film is an official adaptation of the 1994 American film Forrest Gump, which was based on the 1986 novel of the same name by Winston Groom. Laal Singh Chaddha stars Aamir Khan in the lead role, alongside Kareena Kapoor Khan, Naga Chaitanya, and Mona Singh.

#Plot

The film tells the story of Laal Singh Chaddha, a man with a low IQ, who finds himself in the middle of many significant events in Indian history. Born in Punjab, Laal grows up with a strong sense of determination and a heart of gold. Despite facing many challenges, he becomes a successful entrepreneur and a national sensation, inspiring people with his innocence and good intentions. Along the way, he falls in love with Rupa, a girl from his childhood, and befriends Bala, a young boy who becomes his business partner. Through his journey, Laal meets many famous people, including politicians, sports stars, and celebrities, and inadvertently becomes a part of some of the most significant events in Indian history.

#Cast

* Aamir Khan as Laal Singh Chaddha
* Kareena Kapoor Khan as Rupa D'Souza
* Naga Chaitanya as Bala
* Mona Singh as Laal's mother
* Manav Vij as Mohammed Paaji
* Aaryaa Sharma as Young Rupa
* Ahmad Ibn Umar as Young Laal

#Production

##Development

The film was first announced in 2018, with Aamir Khan set to play the lead role. The script was written by Atul Kulkarni, who is known for his work on films like Rang De Basanti and Gangaajal. Advait Chandan, who made his directorial debut with Secret Superstar, was chosen to direct the film. Laal Singh Chaddha is produced by Aamir Khan Productions, Viacom18 Studios, and Paramount Pictures.

##Casting

Aamir Khan was the first choice for the lead role, and he spent over a year preparing for the film. He gained significant weight and underwent a physical transformation to play the role of Laal. Kareena Kapoor Khan was cast as Rupa, Laal's love interest, while Naga Chaitanya made his Bollywood debut with the film. Mona Singh, who is known for her work on television, played the role of Laal's mother.

##Filming

Principal photography began in October 2019 and took place in various locations across India, including Punjab, Chandigarh, and Delhi. The film's shooting was wrapped up in October 2020. Aamir Khan performed many of his stunts himself, including a scene where he runs for over 20 kilometers.

#Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Pritam, with lyrics written by Amitabh Bhattacharya. The album features six songs, including the hit single "Kahani". The music was released on August 5, 2022, and received positive reviews from critics.

#Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in April 2022, with the release of the first teaser poster. The trailer was released on May 29, 2022, and received over 50 million views on YouTube within the first week. Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan promoted the film aggressively, appearing on various television shows and events.

#Release

##Theatrical

Laal Singh Chaddha was released in theaters on August 11, 2022. The film received a wide release, with over 3500 screens in India and over 1000 screens internationally.

##Distribution

The film was distributed by Paramount Pictures and Viacom18 Studios. The film's distribution rights were sold to various countries, including the United States, Canada, Australia, and the United Kingdom.

##Home media

Laal Singh Chaddha was released on Netflix on October 6, 2022. The film was also released on DVD and Blu-ray on November 10, 2022.

#Reception

##Critical response

###India

Laal Singh Chaddha received mixed reviews from Indian critics. While some praised Aamir Khan's performance and the film's visuals, others criticized the film's length and pacing. The Times of India gave the film 3.5 out of 5 stars, stating that "Aamir Khan shines in this soulful and visually stunning film". The Indian Express gave the film 2.5 out of 5 stars, stating that "Laal Singh Chaddha is a film that is more about its star than its story".

###International

The film received generally positive reviews from international critics. The Hollywood Reporter praised Aamir Khan's performance, stating that "he brings a winning vulnerability to the title role". Variety stated that "Laal Singh Chaddha is a charming and engaging film that is elevated by Aamir Khan's performance".

##Box office

Laal Singh Chaddha performed moderately well at the box office. The film grossed over 150 crores in India and over 50 crores internationally. The film's worldwide gross was over 200 crores.

#Accolades

Laal Singh Chaddha won several awards, including the Filmfare Award for Best Actor for Aamir Khan. The film also won the IIFA Award for Best Film and the Screen Award for Best Actor.

#Controversy

Laal Singh Chaddha was involved in a controversy surrounding its release. The film's release was postponed several times due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and the film's marketing campaign was criticized for being insensitive to the pandemic.

article:
ICC Men's T20 World Cup

The ICC Men's T20 World Cup is an international Twenty20 cricket tournament organized by the International Cricket Council (ICC). The tournament is contested by national teams representing their respective ICC member countries. The event is considered one of the most prestigious and competitive international cricket tournaments, attracting massive global attention and participation.

# History

## Background

### Domestic tournaments

The concept of a Twenty20 format was first introduced in 2003 by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) as a domestic competition. The first Twenty20 Cup was held in England in 2003, with 18 teams participating. The format quickly gained popularity, and other countries followed suit, introducing their own domestic Twenty20 tournaments.

### Twenty20 Internationals

The first Twenty20 International (T20I) match was played between Australia and New Zealand in 2005. The match was a huge success, and the format soon gained international recognition. The ICC recognized T20I matches as an official format in 2006.

## Inaugural edition

The inaugural ICC Men's T20 World Cup was held in 2007 in South Africa. The tournament featured 12 teams, with India winning the final against Pakistan. The event was a huge success, with large crowds and high television viewership.

## Expansion to 16 teams

The 2009 ICC Men's T20 World Cup in England saw an expansion to 16 teams, with Ireland and the Netherlands making their tournament debuts. Pakistan won the final against Sri Lanka.

## Expansion to 20 teams

The 2012 ICC Men's T20 World Cup in Sri Lanka saw a further expansion to 20 teams, with Afghanistan, Bangladesh, and Zimbabwe participating for the first time. The West Indies won the final against Sri Lanka.

# Hosts

The ICC Men's T20 World Cup has been hosted by seven countries: South Africa (2007), England (2009), West Indies (2010), Sri Lanka (2012), Bangladesh (2014), India (2016), and United Arab Emirates and Oman (2021). The 2022 tournament will be hosted by Australia.

# Formats

## Qualification

The qualification process for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup is based on the ICC T20I rankings. The top-ranked teams qualify directly for the tournament, while lower-ranked teams participate in a qualifying tournament to determine the remaining spots.

## Final tournament

The final tournament features a group stage followed by a knockout stage. The group stage typically consists of two groups of five teams each, with the top two teams from each group qualifying for the knockout stage.

# Trophy

The ICC Men's T20 World Cup trophy is designed by the ICC and is awarded to the winning team. The trophy is made of silver and gold and features a globe with a cricket ball on top.

# Attendance

The ICC Men's T20 World Cup has consistently attracted large crowds and high television viewership. The 2016 tournament in India saw a record attendance of over 800,000 spectators.

The 2023 Tour de France started in Bilbao, Spain, with a 185-kilometer stage that featured several climbs. The stage was won by Adam Yates (UAE Team Emirates), who also took the yellow jersey. The following stages were won by Victor Lafay (Cofidis) and Jai Hindley (Bora-Hansgrohe), respectively.

The first mountain stage of the Tour took place on Stage 5, which featured a summit finish at Laruns. The stage was won by Jai Hindley (Bora-Hansgrohe), who also took the yellow jersey. article:
Tropical Cyclones in 2022

Tropical cyclones are intense, rotating low-pressure weather systems that form over warm tropical waters. They are also known as hurricanes or typhoons, depending on the region. The year 2022 saw a significant number of tropical cyclones form around the world, causing damage and disruption to various regions.

# Global Atmospheric and Hydrological Conditions

The global atmospheric and hydrological conditions in 2022 were influenced by several climate patterns, including the El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO) and the Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD). The ENSO was in a neutral phase during the first half of the year, while the IOD was in a negative phase. These conditions contributed to an above-average number of tropical cyclones forming in the western Pacific and the eastern Pacific.

# Summary

The 2022 tropical cyclone season saw a total of 146 named storms form around the world, with 81 of them reaching tropical cyclone strength. The most active basin was the western Pacific, which saw 25 named storms form. The eastern Pacific saw 20 named storms form, while the North Atlantic saw 14 named storms form.

## North Atlantic Ocean

The 2022 North Atlantic hurricane season was above average, with 14 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Tropical Storm Alex, formed on June 5, while the last storm, Tropical Storm Nicole, dissipated on November 11. The strongest storm of the season was Hurricane Ian, which reached Category 4 strength on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale.

## Eastern & Central Pacific Ocean

The 2022 Eastern Pacific hurricane season was also above average, with 20 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Tropical Storm Agatha, formed on May 28, while the last storm, Tropical Storm Roslyn, dissipated on October 24. The strongest storm of the season was Hurricane Darby, which reached Category 4 strength on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale.

## Western Pacific Ocean

The 2022 Western Pacific typhoon season was the most active basin of the year, with 25 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Tropical Storm Malakas, formed on January 6, while the last storm, Tropical Storm Pakhar, dissipated on December 29. The strongest storm of the season was Super Typhoon Noru, which reached Category 5 strength on the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) typhoon intensity scale.

## North Indian Ocean

The 2022 North Indian Ocean cyclone season was below average, with 4 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Cyclonic Storm Asani, formed on May 7, while the last storm, Cyclonic Storm Sitrang, dissipated on October 25. The strongest storm of the season was Cyclonic Storm Biparjoy, which reached Category 3 strength on the India Meteorological Department (IMD) cyclone intensity scale.

## South-West Indian Ocean

The 2022 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season was above average, with 12 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Tropical Cyclone Batsirai, formed on January 24, while the last storm, Tropical Cyclone Daphne, dissipated on April 12.

### January - June

The first half of the year saw 6 named storms form in the South-West Indian Ocean. The strongest storm of the period was Tropical Cyclone Batsirai, which reached Category 4 strength on the Météo-France cyclone intensity scale.

### July - December

The second half of the year saw 6 named storms form in the South-West Indian Ocean. The strongest storm of the period was Tropical Cyclone Idai, which reached Category 4 strength on the Météo-France cyclone intensity scale.

## Australian Region

The 2022 Australian region cyclone season was below average, with 4 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Tropical Cyclone Tiffany, formed on January 8, while the last storm, Tropical Cyclone Vernon, dissipated on April 21.

### January - June

The first half of the year saw 2 named storms form in the Australian region. The strongest storm of the period was Tropical Cyclone Sitrang, which reached Category 3 strength on the Australian Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) cyclone intensity scale.

### July - December

The second half of the year saw 2 named storms form in the Australian region. The strongest storm of the period was Tropical Cyclone Daphne, which reached Category 3 strength on the Australian Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) cyclone intensity scale.

## South Pacific Ocean

The 2022 South Pacific cyclone season was above average, with 10 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Tropical Cyclone Cody, formed on January 5, while the last storm, Tropical Cyclone Fili, dissipated on April 12.

### January - June

The first half of the year saw 5 named storms form in the South Pacific Ocean. The strongest storm of the period was Tropical Cyclone Cody, which reached Category 3 strength on the Fiji Meteorological Service (FMS) cyclone intensity scale.

### July - December

The second half of the year saw 5 named storms form in the South Pacific Ocean. The strongest storm of the period was Tropical Cyclone Eva, which reached Category 3 strength on the Fiji Meteorological Service (FMS) cyclone intensity scale.

## South Atlantic Ocean

The 2022 South Atlantic cyclone season was below average, with 2 named storms forming. The first storm of the season, Subtropical Storm Yakecan, formed on May 16, while the last storm, Subtropical Storm Gaston, dissipated on September 29.

# Systems

## January

## February

The month of February saw 4 named storms form around the world. The strongest storm of the month was Tropical Cyclone Sitrang, which reached Category 3 strength on the Australian Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) cyclone intensity scale.

# Global Effects

The 2022 tropical cyclone season had significant effects on various regions around the world. The strongest storm of the season, Super Typhoon Noru, caused widespread damage and disruption in the western Pacific. Takeoff (rapper)

Kirshnik Khari Ball, professionally known as Takeoff, was an American rapper and songwriter. He was best known as a member of the hip-hop trio Migos, alongside his uncle Quavo and cousin Offset. Takeoff's early life and career were marked by his rise to fame as a teenager, and he quickly established himself as a talented rapper and integral part of Migos.

#Early life

Kirshnik Khari Ball was born on June 18, 1994, in Lawrenceville, Georgia. He grew up in a family of musicians, with his uncle Quavo and cousin Offset already involved in the music industry. Takeoff's early life was marked by his love for music, and he began rapping at a young age. He attended Berkmar High School in Lilburn, Georgia, where he met his future Migos group members.

#Career

##2008–2018: Early work with Migos

Takeoff's music career began in 2008 when he formed Migos with Quavo and Offset. The group's early work was marked by their raw energy and unique blend of trap beats and melodic flows. They gained a local following in Atlanta, and their popularity soon spread throughout the United States.

In 2011, Migos released their debut mixtape, "Juug Season." The tape was a moderate success, but it wasn't until the release of their 2012 mixtape "No Label" that the group started to gain mainstream attention. The tape's hit single, "Bando," became a viral sensation, and Migos quickly became one of the most talked-about groups in hip-hop.

In 2013, Migos released their debut studio album, "Yung Rich Nation." The album was a commercial success, and it cemented the group's place in the hip-hop world. Takeoff's contributions to the album were widely praised, and he quickly established himself as a talented rapper and integral part of Migos.

##2018–2021: The Last Rocket and later Migos work

In 2018, Takeoff released his debut solo studio album, "The Last Rocket." The album was a critical and commercial success, and it marked a new chapter in Takeoff's career. The album's lead single, "Last Memory," was a hit, and it showcased Takeoff's growth as a rapper and songwriter.

After the release of "The Last Rocket," Takeoff returned to Migos, and the group released their third studio album, "Culture II." The album was a commercial success, and it featured the hit singles "Stir Fry" and "Walk It Talk It." Takeoff's contributions to the album were widely praised, and he continued to establish himself as a talented rapper and integral part of Migos.

##2022: Friction within Migos and Only Built for Infinity Links

In 2022, Takeoff released his second solo studio album, "Only Built for Infinity Links." The album was a critical and commercial success, and it marked a new chapter in Takeoff's career. The album's lead single, "Crypto," was a hit, and it showcased Takeoff's growth as a rapper and songwriter.

The release of "Only Built for Infinity Links" was marked by friction within Migos. Quavo and Offset had been pursuing solo projects, and Takeoff's decision to release a solo album sparked tensions within the group. The friction eventually led to the group's hiatus, and Takeoff's future with Migos was left uncertain.

#Legal issues

##Georgia Southern University incident

In 2015, Takeoff was involved in an incident at Georgia Southern University. The incident occurred when Migos was scheduled to perform at the university's Spring Bling concert. However, the group's performance was cut short due to a shooting that occurred backstage.

Takeoff was arrested and charged with possession of a firearm on a college campus. He was later released on bail, and the charges were eventually dropped.

##Sexual assault allegations

In 2020, Takeoff was accused of sexual assault by a woman who claimed that the rapper had assaulted her at a party in Los Angeles. The allegations were made public, and Takeoff denied the claims.

The Los Angeles Police Department launched an investigation into the allegations, but no charges were ever filed. Takeoff maintained his innocence throughout the ordeal, and the allegations were eventually dropped.

#Murder and trial

##Reactions

On November 1, 2022, Takeoff was shot and killed outside a bowling alley in Houston, Texas. The shooting occurred after a dispute broke out between Takeoff and a group of men at a private party.

The news of Takeoff's death sent shockwaves through the hip-hop world, and fans and fellow rappers alike paid tribute to the fallen rapper.

##Investigation and legal proceedings

The Houston Police Department launched an investigation into Takeoff's murder, and a suspect was eventually identified. Patrick Xavier Clark, a 33-year-old man, was charged with Takeoff's murder and was later arrested.

The trial is ongoing, and Clark has pleaded not guilty to the charges.

##Funeral

Takeoff's funeral was held on November 11, 2022, at the State Farm Arena in Atlanta, Georgia. The funeral was attended by thousands of fans and fellow rappers, including Quavo and Offset.

Takeoff was laid to rest at the Westview Abbey Cemetery in Atlanta, Georgia.

##Commercial impact

Takeoff's death had a significant commercial impact on the music industry. His music saw a significant surge in streams and sales, and his albums "The Last Rocket" and "Only Built for Infinity Links" both re-entered the charts.

Takeoff's legacy continues to be felt in the hip-hop world, and his music remains popular to this day.

article:
IOS 17
================

IOS 17 is the seventeenth and latest major release of the iOS mobile operating system developed by Apple Inc. It was announced at the company's Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) in June 2023 and was released to the public in September 2023.

Early Development
-----------------

The development of IOS 17 began in 2022, shortly after the release of IOS 16. Apple's engineers and developers worked on incorporating new features, improving performance, and enhancing the overall user experience. The company also conducted internal testing and debugging to ensure the stability and security of the operating system.

System Features
----------------

### Home Screen

The Home Screen in IOS 17 has been redesigned to provide a more personalized and intuitive experience. Users can now customize their Home Screen with new widgets, which offer more information and functionality than before. The widgets are also more interactive, allowing users to perform tasks directly from the Home Screen.

### StandBy

The StandBy mode in IOS 17 is a new feature that allows users to quickly access frequently used features and information. When the iPhone is in StandBy mode, the screen displays a simplified interface with essential information, such as the time, date, and notifications. Users can also access features like the flashlight, camera, and music controls directly from StandBy mode.

### Autocorrect and Text Prediction

The Autocorrect and text prediction features in IOS 17 have been improved to provide more accurate and personalized suggestions. The operating system uses advanced machine learning algorithms to learn the user's typing habits and preferences, allowing it to offer more relevant suggestions and corrections.

### Translation

The Translation feature in IOS 17 has been expanded to support more languages and dialects. Users can now translate text and speech in real-time, using the built-in Translate app or third-party apps that integrate with the feature.

### AirDrop

The AirDrop feature in IOS 17 has been improved to provide faster and more reliable file transfer between devices. Users can now transfer files of any size, and the operating system automatically optimizes the transfer process for faster completion.

### Siri

Siri, Apple's virtual assistant, has been improved in IOS 17 to provide more accurate and helpful responses. Siri can now understand more complex queries and offer more personalized suggestions and recommendations.

### AutoFill

The AutoFill feature in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more secure and convenient password management. The operating system can now automatically fill in passwords and other sensitive information, using advanced encryption and security protocols to protect user data.

### Accessibility

The Accessibility features in IOS 17 have been improved to provide more inclusive and assistive technologies for users with disabilities. The operating system includes new features like enhanced screen readers, improved keyboard navigation, and more customizable accessibility settings.

### Networking

The Networking features in IOS 17 have been improved to provide faster and more reliable connectivity. The operating system includes new features like enhanced Wi-Fi and Bluetooth connectivity, as well as improved support for 5G networks.

### System Settings

The System Settings in IOS 17 have been reorganized and simplified to provide easier access to essential settings and features. Users can now quickly access settings like Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and notifications, as well as more advanced settings like storage and battery usage.

### Charging

The Charging features in IOS 17 have been improved to provide faster and more efficient charging. The operating system includes new features like optimized battery charging, which helps extend the battery life of the iPhone.

App Features
-------------

### Phone

The Phone app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced calling features, like call recording and call transcription, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Messages

The Messages app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced messaging features, like end-to-end encryption and group messaging, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Journal

The Journal app in IOS 17 is a new feature that allows users to record and track their thoughts, feelings, and experiences. The app includes features like voice recording, text entry, and photo capture, as well as advanced analytics and insights to help users reflect on their journal entries.

### Apple Music

The Apple Music app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced music features, like personalized recommendations and live radio, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Apple Maps

The Apple Maps app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced mapping features, like turn-by-turn directions and street view, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Safari

The Safari app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced web features, like tabbed browsing and private browsing, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Notes

The Notes app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced note-taking features, like audio recording and photo capture, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Reminders

The Reminders app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced reminder features, like location-based reminders and recurring reminders, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Photos

The Photos app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced photo features, like editing and sharing, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Camera

The Camera app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced camera features, like portrait mode and night mode, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Weather

The Weather app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced weather features, like forecasts and alerts, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Health

The Health app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced health features, like activity tracking and medical records, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Shortcuts

The Shortcuts app in IOS 17 has been improved to provide more features and functionality. Users can now access more advanced automation features, like custom shortcuts and workflows, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

### Miscellaneous

The Miscellaneous features in IOS 17 include a range of smaller updates and improvements to various apps and services. Users can now access more advanced features and functionality in apps like Stocks, News, and Podcasts, as well as improved integration with other Apple apps and services.

Security and Privacy
---------------------

IOS 17 includes a range of advanced security and privacy features, like end-to-end encryption and secure authentication, to protect user data and ensure a safe and trusted experience.

European Union-specific changes
-------------------------------

The European Union has introduced new regulations and guidelines for mobile operating systems, which have resulted in changes to IOS 17. The operating system now includes features like more transparent data collection and usage, as well as improved user control over app permissions and tracking.

### Initial plans to remove web apps

Apple initially planned to remove web apps from the App Store in IOS 17, citing security and performance concerns. However, the company later reversed this decision, allowing web apps to remain available on the App Store.

Known Issues
-------------

IOS 17 has experienced some known issues and bugs, like compatibility problems with certain apps and devices, as well as occasional crashes and freezes. Apple has released several updates and patches to address these issues and improve the overall stability and performance of the operating system.

Supported Devices
-----------------

IOS 17 is supported on a range of Apple devices, including the iPhone 8 and later, iPad Air and later, and iPod touch (7th generation).

Release History
----------------

IOS 17 was released to the public in September 2023, following several beta releases and developer previews.

Reception
----------

IOS 17 has received generally positive reviews from critics and users, who have praised its new features and improvements, as well as its stability and performance. However, some users have reported issues with compatibility and bugs, which Apple has addressed through updates and patches.

------

2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage

The 2022 FIFA World Cup knockout stage was the second and final stage of the 2022 FIFA World Cup, following the group stage. The stage began on December 3, 2022, and ended on December 18, 2022, with the final match at the Lusail Iconic Stadium in Lusail, Qatar.

# Format

The knockout stage consisted of a single-elimination tournament, with each match played as a single leg. If the score was tied after the regular 90 minutes of play, the match would go into extra time, consisting of two 15-minute periods. If the score remained tied after extra time, the match would be decided by a penalty shootout.

# Qualified teams

The top two teams from each of the eight groups in the group stage qualified for the knockout stage. The teams were:

* Group A: Netherlands, Senegal
* Group B: England, United States
* Group C: Argentina, Poland
* Group D: France, Australia
* Group E: Japan, Spain
* Group F: Morocco, Croatia
* Group G: Brazil, Switzerland
* Group H: Portugal, South Korea

# Bracket

The knockout stage bracket was determined by the teams' group stage finish. The winners of each group played the runners-up of another group.

Round of 16

* Netherlands (A1) vs United States (B2)
* Argentina (C1) vs Australia (D2)
* France (D1) vs Poland (C2)
* England (B1) vs Senegal (A2)
* Japan (E1) vs Croatia (F2)
* Brazil (G1) vs South Korea (H2)

# Round of 16

## Netherlands vs United States

The Netherlands and United States played each other in the first match of the Round of 16 on December 3, 2022, at the Khalifa International Stadium in Al Rayyan. The Netherlands won the match 3-1, with goals from Memphis Depay, Daley Blind, and Denzel Dumfries.

## Argentina vs Australia

Argentina played Australia on December 3, 2022, at the Ahmad bin Ali Stadium in Al Rayyan. Argentina won the match 2-1, with goals from Lionel Messi and Julián Álvarez.

## England vs Senegal

England played Senegal on December 4, 2022, at the Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor. England won the match 3-0, with goals from Jordan Henderson, Harry Kane, and Bukayo Saka.

## Japan vs Croatia

Japan played Croatia on December 5, 2022, at the Al Janoub Stadium in Al Wakrah. Japan lost the match 1-1 (3-1) in a penalty shootout, after the regular 90 minutes of play ended 1-1.

## Brazil vs South Korea

Brazil played South Korea on December 5, 2022, at the Stadium 974 in Doha. Brazil won the match 4-1, with goals from Vinícius Júnior, Neymar, Richarlison, and Lucas Paquetá.

## Morocco vs Spain

Morocco played Spain on December 6, 2022, at the Education City Stadium in Al Rayyan. Morocco won the match 0-0 (3-0) in a penalty shootout, after the regular 90 minutes of play ended 0-0.

## Portugal vs Switzerland

Portugal played Switzerland on December 6, 2022, at the Lusail Iconic Stadium in Lusail. Portugal won the match 6-1, with goals from Gonçalo Ramos (3), Pepe, Raphaël Guerreiro, and Rafael Leão.

# Quarter-finals

## Croatia vs Brazil

Croatia played Brazil on December 9, 2022, at the Education City Stadium in Al Rayyan. Brazil lost the match 1-1 (4-2) in a penalty shootout, after the regular 90 minutes of play ended 1-1.

## Morocco vs Portugal

Morocco played Portugal on December 10, 2022, at the Al Thakira Stadium in Al Khor. Morocco won the match 1-0, with a goal from Youssef En-Nesyri.

## England vs France

England played France on December 10, 2022, at the Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor. France won the match 2-1, with goals from Aurélien Tchouaméni and Olivier Giroud.

# Semi-finals

# Final

Argentina played France on December 18, 2022, at the Lusail Iconic Stadium in Lusail. Argentina won the match 3-3 (4-2) in a penalty shootout, after the regular 90 minutes of play ended 2-2 and extra time ended 3-3.
